250 namespace {
251  // Depending on the platform the struct utmp (or utmpx) has either ut_name or ut_user
252  // which are semantically equivalent. Instead of using preprocessor magic,
253  // which is bothersome for cxx modules use SFINAE.
254 
255  template<typename T>
256  struct ut_name {
257  template<typename U = T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_member_pointer<decltype(&U::ut_name)>::value, int>::type = 0>
258  static char getValue(U* ue, int) {
259  return ue->ut_name[0];
260  }
261 
262  template<typename U = T, typename std::enable_if<std::is_member_pointer<decltype(&U::ut_user)>::value, int>::type = 0>
263  static char getValue(U* ue, long) {
264  return ue->ut_user[0];
265  }
266  };
267 
268  static char get_ut_name(STRUCT_UTMP *ue) {
269  // 0 is an integer literal forcing an overload pickup in case both ut_name and ut_user are present.
270  return ut_name<STRUCT_UTMP>::getValue(ue, 0);
271  }
272 }
273 
274 struct TUtmpContent {
275  STRUCT_UTMP *fUtmpContents;
276  UInt_t fEntries; // Number of entries in utmp file.
277 
278  TUtmpContent() : fUtmpContents(0), fEntries(0) {}
279  ~TUtmpContent() { free(fUtmpContents); }
280 
281  STRUCT_UTMP *SearchUtmpEntry(const char *tty)
282  {
283  // Look for utmp entry which is connected to terminal tty.
284 
285  STRUCT_UTMP *ue = fUtmpContents;
286 
287  UInt_t n = fEntries;
288  while (n--) {
289  if (get_ut_name(ue) && !strncmp(tty, ue->ut_line, sizeof(ue->ut_line)))
290  return ue;
291  ue++;
292  }
293  return 0;
294  }
295 
296  int ReadUtmpFile()
297  {
298  // Read utmp file. Returns number of entries in utmp file.
299 
300  FILE *utmp;
301  struct stat file_stats;
302  size_t n_read, size;
303 
304  fEntries = 0;
305 
306  R__LOCKGUARD2(gSystemMutex);
307 
308  utmp = fopen(UTMP_FILE, "r");
309  if (!utmp)
310  return 0;
311 
312  if (fstat(fileno(utmp), &file_stats) == -1) {
313  fclose(utmp);
314  return 0;
315  }
316  size = file_stats.st_size;
317  if (size <= 0) {
318  fclose(utmp);
319  return 0;
320  }
321 
322  fUtmpContents = (STRUCT_UTMP *) malloc(size);
323  if (!fUtmpContents) {
324  fclose(utmp);
325  return 0;
326  }
327 
328  n_read = fread(fUtmpContents, 1, size, utmp);
329  if (!ferror(utmp)) {
330  if (fclose(utmp) != EOF && n_read == size) {
331  fEntries = size / sizeof(STRUCT_UTMP);
332  return fEntries;
333  }
334  } else
335  fclose(utmp);
336 
337  free(fUtmpContents);
338  fUtmpContents = 0;
339  return 0;
340  }

347 //------------------- Unix TFdSet ----------------------------------------------
348 #ifndef HOWMANY
349 # define HOWMANY(x, y) (((x)+((y)-1))/(y))
350 #endif
351 
352 const Int_t kNFDBITS = (sizeof(Long_t) * 8); // 8 bits per byte
353 #ifdef FD_SETSIZE
354 const Int_t kFDSETSIZE = FD_SETSIZE; // Linux = 1024 file descriptors
355 #else
356 const Int_t kFDSETSIZE = 256; // upto 256 file descriptors
357 #endif
358 
359 
360 class TFdSet {
361 private:
362  ULong_t fds_bits[HOWMANY(kFDSETSIZE, kNFDBITS)];
363 public:
364  TFdSet() { memset(fds_bits, 0, sizeof(fds_bits)); }
365  TFdSet(const TFdSet &org) { memcpy(fds_bits, org.fds_bits, sizeof(org.fds_bits)); }
366  TFdSet &operator=(const TFdSet &rhs) { if (this != &rhs) { memcpy(fds_bits, rhs.fds_bits, sizeof(rhs.fds_bits));} return *this; }
367  void Zero() { memset(fds_bits, 0, sizeof(fds_bits)); }
368  void Set(Int_t n)
369  {
370  if (n >= 0 && n < kFDSETSIZE) {
371  fds_bits[n/kNFDBITS] |= (1UL << (n % kNFDBITS));
372  } else {
373  ::Fatal("TFdSet::Set","fd (%d) out of range [0..%d]", n, kFDSETSIZE-1);
374  }
375  }
376  void Clr(Int_t n)
377  {
378  if (n >= 0 && n < kFDSETSIZE) {
379  fds_bits[n/kNFDBITS] &= ~(1UL << (n % kNFDBITS));
380  } else {
381  ::Fatal("TFdSet::Clr","fd (%d) out of range [0..%d]", n, kFDSETSIZE-1);
382  }
383  }
384  Int_t IsSet(Int_t n)
385  {
386  if (n >= 0 && n < kFDSETSIZE) {
387  return (fds_bits[n/kNFDBITS] & (1UL << (n % kNFDBITS))) != 0;
388  } else {
389  ::Fatal("TFdSet::IsSet","fd (%d) out of range [0..%d]", n, kFDSETSIZE-1);
390  return 0;
391  }
392  }
393  ULong_t *GetBits() { return (ULong_t *)fds_bits; }
394 };

405 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
406 
407 static const char *GetExePath()
408 {
409  TTHREAD_TLS_DECL(TString,exepath);
410  if (exepath == "") {
411 #if defined(R__MACOSX)
412  exepath = _dyld_get_image_name(0);
413 #elif defined(R__LINUX) || defined(R__SOLARIS) || defined(R__FBSD)
414  char buf[kMAXPATHLEN]; // exe path name
415 
416  // get the name from the link in /proc
417 #if defined(R__LINUX)
418  int ret = readlink("/proc/self/exe", buf, kMAXPATHLEN);
419 #elif defined(R__SOLARIS)
420  int ret = readlink("/proc/self/path/a.out", buf, kMAXPATHLEN);
421 #elif defined(R__FBSD)
422  int ret = readlink("/proc/curproc/file", buf, kMAXPATHLEN);
423 #endif
424  if (ret > 0 && ret < kMAXPATHLEN) {
425  buf[ret] = 0;
426  exepath = buf;
427  }
428 #else
429  if (!gApplication)
430  return exepath;
431  TString p = gApplication->Argv(0);
432  if (p.BeginsWith("/"))
433  exepath = p;
434  else if (p.Contains("/")) {
435  exepath = gSystem->WorkingDirectory();
436  exepath += "/";
437  exepath += p;
438  } else {
439  char *exe = gSystem->Which(gSystem->Getenv("PATH"), p, kExecutePermission);
440  if (exe) {
441  exepath = exe;
442  delete [] exe;
443  }
444  }
445 #endif
446  }
447  return exepath;
448 }

450 #if defined(HAVE_DLADDR) && !defined(R__MACOSX)
451 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
452 
453 static void SetRootSys()
454 {
455 #ifdef ROOTPREFIX
456  if (gSystem->Getenv("ROOTIGNOREPREFIX")) {
457 #endif
458  void *addr = (void *)SetRootSys;
459  Dl_info info;
460  if (dladdr(addr, &info) && info.dli_fname && info.dli_fname[0]) {
461  char respath[kMAXPATHLEN];
462  if (!realpath(info.dli_fname, respath)) {
463  if (!gSystem->Getenv("ROOTSYS"))
464  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::SetRootSys", "error getting realpath of libCore, please set ROOTSYS in the shell");
465  } else {
466  TString rs = gSystem->DirName(respath);
467  gSystem->Setenv("ROOTSYS", gSystem->DirName(rs));
468  }
469  }
470 #ifdef ROOTPREFIX
471  }
472 #endif
473 }
474 #endif
475 
476 #if defined(R__MACOSX)
477 static TString gLinkedDylibs;
478 
479 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
480 
481 static void DylibAdded(const struct mach_header *mh, intptr_t /* vmaddr_slide */)
482 {
483  static int i = 0;
484  static Bool_t gotFirstSo = kFALSE;
485  static TString linkedDylibs;
486 
487  // to copy the local linkedDylibs to the global gLinkedDylibs call this
488  // function with mh==0
489  if (!mh) {
490  gLinkedDylibs = linkedDylibs;
491  return;
492  }
493 
494  TString lib = _dyld_get_image_name(i++);
495 
496  TRegexp sovers = "libCore\\.[0-9]+\\.*[0-9]*\\.*[0-9]*\\.so";
497  TRegexp dyvers = "libCore\\.[0-9]+\\.*[0-9]*\\.*[0-9]*\\.dylib";
498 
499 #ifdef ROOTPREFIX
500  if (gSystem->Getenv("ROOTIGNOREPREFIX")) {
501 #endif
502  if (lib.EndsWith("libCore.dylib") || lib.EndsWith("libCore.so") ||
503  lib.Index(sovers) != kNPOS || lib.Index(dyvers) != kNPOS) {
504  char respath[kMAXPATHLEN];
505  if (!realpath(lib, respath)) {
506  if (!gSystem->Getenv("ROOTSYS"))
507  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::DylibAdded", "error getting realpath of libCore, please set ROOTSYS in the shell");
508  } else {
509  TString rs = gSystem->DirName(respath);
510  gSystem->Setenv("ROOTSYS", gSystem->DirName(rs));
511  }
512  }
513 #ifdef ROOTPREFIX
514  }
515 #endif
516 
517  // when libSystem.B.dylib is loaded we have finished loading all dylibs
518  // explicitly linked against the executable. Additional dylibs
519  // come when they are explicitly linked against loaded so's, currently
520  // we are not interested in these
521  if (lib.EndsWith("/libSystem.B.dylib"))
522  gotFirstSo = kTRUE;
523 
524  // add all libs loaded before libSystem.B.dylib
525  if (!gotFirstSo && (lib.EndsWith(".dylib") || lib.EndsWith(".so"))) {
526  sovers = "\\.[0-9]+\\.*[0-9]*\\.so";
527  Ssiz_t idx = lib.Index(sovers);
528  if (idx != kNPOS) {
529  lib.Remove(idx);
530  lib += ".so";
531  }
532  dyvers = "\\.[0-9]+\\.*[0-9]*\\.dylib";
533  idx = lib.Index(dyvers);
534  if (idx != kNPOS) {
535  lib.Remove(idx);
536  lib += ".dylib";
537  }
538  if (!gSystem->AccessPathName(lib, kReadPermission)) {
539  if (linkedDylibs.Length())
540  linkedDylibs += " ";
541  linkedDylibs += lib;
542  }
543  }
544 }
545 #endif

567 
568 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
569 /// Initialize Unix system interface.
570 
571 Bool_t TUnixSystem::Init()
572 {
573  if (TSystem::Init())
574  return kTRUE;
575 
576  fReadmask = new TFdSet;
577  fWritemask = new TFdSet;
578  fReadready = new TFdSet;
579  fWriteready = new TFdSet;
580  fSignals = new TFdSet;
581 
582  //--- install default handlers
583  UnixSignal(kSigChild, SigHandler);
584  UnixSignal(kSigBus, SigHandler);
585  UnixSignal(kSigSegmentationViolation, SigHandler);
586  UnixSignal(kSigIllegalInstruction, SigHandler);
587  UnixSignal(kSigSystem, SigHandler);
588  UnixSignal(kSigAlarm, SigHandler);
589  UnixSignal(kSigUrgent, SigHandler);
590  UnixSignal(kSigFloatingException, SigHandler);
591  UnixSignal(kSigWindowChanged, SigHandler);
592  UnixSignal(kSigUser2, SigHandler);
593 
594 #if defined(R__MACOSX)
595  // trap loading of all dylibs to register dylib name,
596  // sets also ROOTSYS if built without ROOTPREFIX
597  _dyld_register_func_for_add_image(DylibAdded);
598 #elif defined(HAVE_DLADDR)
599  SetRootSys();
600 #endif
601 
602  // This is a fallback in case TROOT::GetRootSys() can't determine ROOTSYS
603  gRootDir = "/usr/local/root";
604 
605  return kFALSE;
606 }
607 
608 //---- Misc --------------------------------------------------------------------

610 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
611 /// Set the application name (from command line, argv[0]) and copy it in
612 /// gProgName. Copy the application pathname in gProgPath.
613 /// If name is 0 let the system set the actual executable name and path
614 /// (works on MacOS X and Linux).
615 
616 void TUnixSystem::SetProgname(const char *name)
617 {
618  if (gProgName)
619  delete [] gProgName;
620  if (gProgPath)
621  delete [] gProgPath;
622 
623  if (!name || !*name) {
624  name = GetExePath();
625  gProgName = StrDup(BaseName(name));
626  gProgPath = StrDup(DirName(name));
627  } else {
628  gProgName = StrDup(BaseName(name));
629  char *w = Which(Getenv("PATH"), gProgName);
630  gProgPath = StrDup(DirName(w));
631  delete [] w;
632  }
633 }
634 
635 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
636 /// Set DISPLAY environment variable based on utmp entry. Only for UNIX.
637 
638 void TUnixSystem::SetDisplay()
639 {
640  if (!Getenv("DISPLAY")) {
641  char *tty = ::ttyname(0); // device user is logged in on
642  if (tty) {
643  tty += 5; // remove "/dev/"
644 
645  TUtmpContent utmp;
646  utmp.ReadUtmpFile();
647 
648  STRUCT_UTMP *utmp_entry = utmp.SearchUtmpEntry(tty);
649  if (utmp_entry) {
650  if (utmp_entry->ut_host[0]) {
651  if (strchr(utmp_entry->ut_host, ':')) {
652  Setenv("DISPLAY", utmp_entry->ut_host);
653  Warning("SetDisplay", "DISPLAY not set, setting it to %s",
654  utmp_entry->ut_host);
655  } else {
656  char disp[260];
657  snprintf(disp, sizeof(disp), "%s:0.0", utmp_entry->ut_host);
658  Setenv("DISPLAY", disp);
659  Warning("SetDisplay", "DISPLAY not set, setting it to %s",
660  disp);
661  }
662  }
663 #ifndef UTMP_NO_ADDR
664  else if (utmp_entry->ut_addr) {
665 
666  struct sockaddr_in addr;
667  addr.sin_family = AF_INET;
668  addr.sin_port = 0;
669  memcpy(&addr.sin_addr, &utmp_entry->ut_addr, sizeof(addr.sin_addr));
670  memset(&addr.sin_zero[0], 0, sizeof(addr.sin_zero));
671  struct sockaddr *sa = (struct sockaddr *) &addr; // input
672 
673  char hbuf[NI_MAXHOST + 4];
674  if (getnameinfo(sa, sizeof(struct sockaddr), hbuf, sizeof(hbuf), nullptr, 0, NI_NAMEREQD) == 0) {
675  assert( strlen(hbuf) < NI_MAXHOST );
676  strcat(hbuf, ":0.0");
677  Setenv("DISPLAY", hbuf);
678  Warning("SetDisplay", "DISPLAY not set, setting it to %s",
679  hbuf);
680  }
681  }
682 #endif
683  }
684  }
685 #ifndef R__HAS_COCOA
686  if (!gROOT->IsBatch() && !getenv("DISPLAY")) {
687  Error("SetDisplay", "Can't figure out DISPLAY, set it manually\n"
688  "In case you run a remote ssh session, restart your ssh session with:\n"
689  "=========> ssh -Y");
690  }
691 #endif
692  }
693 }
694 
695 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
696 /// Return system error string.
697 
698 const char *TUnixSystem::GetError()
699 {
700  Int_t err = GetErrno();
701  if (err == 0 && GetLastErrorString() != "")
702  return GetLastErrorString();
703 
704 #if defined(R__SOLARIS) || defined (R__LINUX) || defined(R__AIX) || \
705  defined(R__FBSD) || defined(R__OBSD) || defined(R__HURD)
706  return strerror(err);
707 #else
708  if (err < 0 || err >= sys_nerr)
709  return Form("errno out of range %d", err);
710  return sys_errlist[err];
711 #endif
712 }
713 
714 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
715 /// Return the system's host name.
716 
717 const char *TUnixSystem::HostName()
718 {
719  if (fHostname == "") {
720  char hn[64];
721 #if defined(R__SOLARIS)
722  sysinfo(SI_HOSTNAME, hn, sizeof(hn));
723 #else
724  gethostname(hn, sizeof(hn));
725 #endif
726  fHostname = hn;
727  }
728  return (const char *)fHostname;
729 }

731 //---- EventLoop ---------------------------------------------------------------
732 
733 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
734 /// Add a file handler to the list of system file handlers. Only adds
735 /// the handler if it is not already in the list of file handlers.
736 
737 void TUnixSystem::AddFileHandler(TFileHandler *h)
738 {
739  R__LOCKGUARD2(gSystemMutex);
740 
741  TSystem::AddFileHandler(h);
742  if (h) {
743  int fd = h->GetFd();
744  if (h->HasReadInterest()) {
745  fReadmask->Set(fd);
746  fMaxrfd = TMath::Max(fMaxrfd, fd);
747  }
748  if (h->HasWriteInterest()) {
749  fWritemask->Set(fd);
750  fMaxwfd = TMath::Max(fMaxwfd, fd);
751  }
752  }
753 }
754 
755 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
756 /// Remove a file handler from the list of file handlers. Returns
757 /// the handler or 0 if the handler was not in the list of file handlers.
758 
759 TFileHandler *TUnixSystem::RemoveFileHandler(TFileHandler *h)
760 {
761  if (!h) return 0;
762 
763  R__LOCKGUARD2(gSystemMutex);
764 
765  TFileHandler *oh = TSystem::RemoveFileHandler(h);
766  if (oh) { // found
767  TFileHandler *th;
768  TIter next(fFileHandler);
769  fMaxrfd = -1;
770  fMaxwfd = -1;
771  fReadmask->Zero();
772  fWritemask->Zero();
773  while ((th = (TFileHandler *) next())) {
774  int fd = th->GetFd();
775  if (th->HasReadInterest()) {
776  fReadmask->Set(fd);
777  fMaxrfd = TMath::Max(fMaxrfd, fd);
778  }
779  if (th->HasWriteInterest()) {
780  fWritemask->Set(fd);
781  fMaxwfd = TMath::Max(fMaxwfd, fd);
782  }
783  }
784  }
785  return oh;
786 }
787 
788 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
789 /// Add a signal handler to list of system signal handlers. Only adds
790 /// the handler if it is not already in the list of signal handlers.
791 
792 void TUnixSystem::AddSignalHandler(TSignalHandler *h)
793 {
794  R__LOCKGUARD2(gSystemMutex);
795 
796  TSystem::AddSignalHandler(h);
797  UnixSignal(h->GetSignal(), SigHandler);
798 }
799 
800 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
801 /// Remove a signal handler from list of signal handlers. Returns
802 /// the handler or 0 if the handler was not in the list of signal handlers.
803 
804 TSignalHandler *TUnixSystem::RemoveSignalHandler(TSignalHandler *h)
805 {
806  if (!h) return 0;
807 
808  R__LOCKGUARD2(gSystemMutex);
809 
810  TSignalHandler *oh = TSystem::RemoveSignalHandler(h);
811 
812  Bool_t last = kTRUE;
813  TSignalHandler *hs;
814  TIter next(fSignalHandler);
815 
816  while ((hs = (TSignalHandler*) next())) {
817  if (hs->GetSignal() == h->GetSignal())
818  last = kFALSE;
819  }
820  if (last)
821  ResetSignal(h->GetSignal(), kTRUE);
822 
823  return oh;
824 }
825 
826 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
827 /// If reset is true reset the signal handler for the specified signal
828 /// to the default handler, else restore previous behaviour.
829 
830 void TUnixSystem::ResetSignal(ESignals sig, Bool_t reset)
831 {
832  if (reset)
833  UnixResetSignal(sig);
834  else
835  UnixSignal(sig, SigHandler);
836 }
837 
838 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
839 /// Reset signals handlers to previous behaviour.
840 
841 void TUnixSystem::ResetSignals()
842 {
843  UnixResetSignals();
844 }
845 
846 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
847 /// If ignore is true ignore the specified signal, else restore previous
848 /// behaviour.
849 
850 void TUnixSystem::IgnoreSignal(ESignals sig, Bool_t ignore)
851 {
852  UnixIgnoreSignal(sig, ignore);
853 }
854 
855 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
856 /// When the argument is true the SIGALRM signal handler is set so that
857 /// interrupted syscalls will not be restarted by the kernel. This is
858 /// typically used in case one wants to put a timeout on an I/O operation.
859 /// By default interrupted syscalls will always be restarted (for all
860 /// signals). This can be controlled for each a-synchronous TTimer via
861 /// the method TTimer::SetInterruptSyscalls().
862 
863 void TUnixSystem::SigAlarmInterruptsSyscalls(Bool_t set)
864 {
865  UnixSigAlarmInterruptsSyscalls(set);
866 }
867 
868 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
869 /// Return the bitmap of conditions that trigger a floating point exception.
870 
871 Int_t TUnixSystem::GetFPEMask()
872 {
873  Int_t mask = 0;
874 
875 #if defined(R__LINUX) && !defined(__powerpc__)
876 #if defined(__GLIBC__) && (__GLIBC__>2 || __GLIBC__==2 && __GLIBC_MINOR__>=1)
877 
878 #if __GLIBC_MINOR__>=3
879 
880  Int_t oldmask = fegetexcept();
881 
882 #else
883  fenv_t oldenv;
884  fegetenv(&oldenv);
885  fesetenv(&oldenv);
886 #if __ia64__
887  Int_t oldmask = ~oldenv;
888 #else
889  Int_t oldmask = ~oldenv.__control_word;
890 #endif
891 #endif
892 
893  if (oldmask & FE_INVALID ) mask |= kInvalid;
894  if (oldmask & FE_DIVBYZERO) mask |= kDivByZero;
895  if (oldmask & FE_OVERFLOW ) mask |= kOverflow;
896  if (oldmask & FE_UNDERFLOW) mask |= kUnderflow;
897 # ifdef FE_INEXACT
898  if (oldmask & FE_INEXACT ) mask |= kInexact;
899 # endif
900 #endif
901 #endif
902 
903 #if defined(R__MACOSX) && defined(__SSE2__)
904  // OS X uses the SSE unit for all FP math by default, not the x87 FP unit
905  Int_t oldmask = ~_MM_GET_EXCEPTION_MASK();
906 
907  if (oldmask & _MM_MASK_INVALID ) mask |= kInvalid;
908  if (oldmask & _MM_MASK_DIV_ZERO ) mask |= kDivByZero;
909  if (oldmask & _MM_MASK_OVERFLOW ) mask |= kOverflow;
910  if (oldmask & _MM_MASK_UNDERFLOW) mask |= kUnderflow;
911  if (oldmask & _MM_MASK_INEXACT ) mask |= kInexact;
912 #endif
913 
914 #if defined(R__MACOSX) && !defined(__SSE2__) && \
915  (defined(__i386__) || defined(__x86_64__) || defined(__arm__) || defined(__arm64__))
916  fenv_t oldenv;
917  fegetenv(&oldenv);
918  fesetenv(&oldenv);
919 #if defined(__arm__)
920  Int_t oldmask = ~oldenv.__fpscr;
921 #elif defined(__arm64__)
922  Int_t oldmask = ~oldenv.__fpcr;
923 #else
924  Int_t oldmask = ~oldenv.__control;
925 #endif
926 
927  if (oldmask & FE_INVALID ) mask |= kInvalid;
928  if (oldmask & FE_DIVBYZERO) mask |= kDivByZero;
929  if (oldmask & FE_OVERFLOW ) mask |= kOverflow;
930  if (oldmask & FE_UNDERFLOW) mask |= kUnderflow;
931  if (oldmask & FE_INEXACT ) mask |= kInexact;
932 #endif
933 
934 #if defined(R__MACOSX) && !defined(__SSE2__) && !defined(__xlC__) && \
935  !defined(__i386__) && !defined(__x86_64__) && !defined(__arm__) && \
936  !defined(__arm64__)
937  Long64_t oldmask;
938  fegetenvd(oldmask);
939 
940  if (oldmask & FE_ENABLE_INVALID ) mask |= kInvalid;
941  if (oldmask & FE_ENABLE_DIVBYZERO) mask |= kDivByZero;
942  if (oldmask & FE_ENABLE_OVERFLOW ) mask |= kOverflow;
943  if (oldmask & FE_ENABLE_UNDERFLOW) mask |= kUnderflow;
944  if (oldmask & FE_ENABLE_INEXACT ) mask |= kInexact;
945 #endif
946 
947  return mask;
948 }
949 
950 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
951 /// Set which conditions trigger a floating point exception.
952 /// Return the previous set of conditions.
953 
954 Int_t TUnixSystem::SetFPEMask(Int_t mask)
955 {
956  if (mask) { } // use mask to avoid warning
957 
958  Int_t old = GetFPEMask();
959 
960 #if defined(R__LINUX) && !defined(__powerpc__)
961 #if defined(__GLIBC__) && (__GLIBC__>2 || __GLIBC__==2 && __GLIBC_MINOR__>=1)
962  Int_t newm = 0;
963  if (mask & kInvalid ) newm |= FE_INVALID;
964  if (mask & kDivByZero) newm |= FE_DIVBYZERO;
965  if (mask & kOverflow ) newm |= FE_OVERFLOW;
966  if (mask & kUnderflow) newm |= FE_UNDERFLOW;
967 # ifdef FE_INEXACT
968  if (mask & kInexact ) newm |= FE_INEXACT;
969 # endif
970 
971 #if __GLIBC_MINOR__>=3
972 
973  // clear pending exceptions so feenableexcept does not trigger them
974  feclearexcept(FE_ALL_EXCEPT);
975  fedisableexcept(FE_ALL_EXCEPT);
976  feenableexcept(newm);
977 
978 #else
979 
980  fenv_t cur;
981  fegetenv(&cur);
982 #if defined __ia64__
983  cur &= ~newm;
984 #else
985  cur.__control_word &= ~newm;
986 #endif
987  fesetenv(&cur);
988 
989 #endif
990 #endif
991 #endif
992 
993 #if defined(R__MACOSX) && defined(__SSE2__)
994  // OS X uses the SSE unit for all FP math by default, not the x87 FP unit
995  Int_t newm = 0;
996  if (mask & kInvalid ) newm |= _MM_MASK_INVALID;
997  if (mask & kDivByZero) newm |= _MM_MASK_DIV_ZERO;
998  if (mask & kOverflow ) newm |= _MM_MASK_OVERFLOW;
999  if (mask & kUnderflow) newm |= _MM_MASK_UNDERFLOW;
1000  if (mask & kInexact ) newm |= _MM_MASK_INEXACT;
1001 
1002  _MM_SET_EXCEPTION_MASK(_MM_GET_EXCEPTION_MASK() & ~newm);
1003 #endif
1004 
1005 #if defined(R__MACOSX) && !defined(__SSE2__) && \
1006  (defined(__i386__) || defined(__x86_64__) || defined(__arm__) || defined(__arm64__))
1007  Int_t newm = 0;
1008  if (mask & kInvalid ) newm |= FE_INVALID;
1009  if (mask & kDivByZero) newm |= FE_DIVBYZERO;
1010  if (mask & kOverflow ) newm |= FE_OVERFLOW;
1011  if (mask & kUnderflow) newm |= FE_UNDERFLOW;
1012  if (mask & kInexact ) newm |= FE_INEXACT;
1013 
1014  fenv_t cur;
1015  fegetenv(&cur);
1016 #if defined(__arm__)
1017  cur.__fpscr &= ~newm;
1018 #elif defined(__arm64__)
1019  cur.__fpcr &= ~newm;
1020 #else
1021  cur.__control &= ~newm;
1022 #endif
1023  fesetenv(&cur);
1024 #endif
1025 
1026 #if defined(R__MACOSX) && !defined(__SSE2__) && !defined(__xlC__) && \
1027  !defined(__i386__) && !defined(__x86_64__) && !defined(__arm__) && \
1028  !defined(__arm64__)
1029  Int_t newm = 0;
1030  if (mask & kInvalid ) newm |= FE_ENABLE_INVALID;
1031  if (mask & kDivByZero) newm |= FE_ENABLE_DIVBYZERO;
1032  if (mask & kOverflow ) newm |= FE_ENABLE_OVERFLOW;
1033  if (mask & kUnderflow) newm |= FE_ENABLE_UNDERFLOW;
1034  if (mask & kInexact ) newm |= FE_ENABLE_INEXACT;
1035 
1036  Long64_t curmask;
1037  fegetenvd(curmask);
1038  curmask = (curmask & ~FE_ENABLE_ALL_EXCEPT) | newm;
1039  fesetenvd(curmask);
1040 #endif
1041 
1042  return old;
1043 }
1044 
1045 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1046 /// Dispatch a single event.
1047 
1048 void TUnixSystem::DispatchOneEvent(Bool_t pendingOnly)
1049 {
1050  Bool_t pollOnce = pendingOnly;
1051 
1052  while (1) {
1053  // first handle any X11 events
1054  if (gXDisplay && gXDisplay->Notify()) {
1055  if (fReadready->IsSet(gXDisplay->GetFd())) {
1056  fReadready->Clr(gXDisplay->GetFd());
1057  fNfd--;
1058  }
1059  if (!pendingOnly) return;
1060  }
1061 
1062  // check for file descriptors ready for reading/writing
1063  if (fNfd > 0 && fFileHandler && fFileHandler->GetSize() > 0)
1064  if (CheckDescriptors())
1065  if (!pendingOnly) return;
1066  fNfd = 0;
1067  fReadready->Zero();
1068  fWriteready->Zero();
1069 
1070  if (pendingOnly && !pollOnce)
1071  return;
1072 
1073  // check synchronous signals
1074  if (fSigcnt > 0 && fSignalHandler->GetSize() > 0)
1075  if (CheckSignals(kTRUE))
1076  if (!pendingOnly) return;
1077  fSigcnt = 0;
1078  fSignals->Zero();
1079 
1080  // check synchronous timers
1081  Long_t nextto;
1082  if (fTimers && fTimers->GetSize() > 0)
1083  if (DispatchTimers(kTRUE)) {
1084  // prevent timers from blocking file descriptor monitoring
1085  nextto = NextTimeOut(kTRUE);
1086  if (nextto > kItimerResolution || nextto == -1)
1087  return;
1088  }
1089 
1090  // if in pendingOnly mode poll once file descriptor activity
1091  nextto = NextTimeOut(kTRUE);
1092  if (pendingOnly) {
1093  if (fFileHandler && fFileHandler->GetSize() == 0)
1094  return;
1095  nextto = 0;
1096  pollOnce = kFALSE;
1097  }
1098 
1099  // nothing ready, so setup select call
1100  *fReadready = *fReadmask;
1101  *fWriteready = *fWritemask;
1102 
1103  int mxfd = TMath::Max(fMaxrfd, fMaxwfd);
1104  mxfd++;
1105 
1106  // if nothing to select (socket or timer) return
1107  if (mxfd == 0 && nextto == -1)
1108  return;
1109 
1110  fNfd = UnixSelect(mxfd, fReadready, fWriteready, nextto);
1111  if (fNfd < 0 && fNfd != -2) {
1112  int fd, rc;
1113  TFdSet t;
1114  for (fd = 0; fd < mxfd; fd++) {
1115  t.Set(fd);
1116  if (fReadmask->IsSet(fd)) {
1117  rc = UnixSelect(fd+1, &t, 0, 0);
1118  if (rc < 0 && rc != -2) {
1119  SysError("DispatchOneEvent", "select: read error on %d", fd);
1120  fReadmask->Clr(fd);
1121  }
1122  }
1123  if (fWritemask->IsSet(fd)) {
1124  rc = UnixSelect(fd+1, 0, &t, 0);
1125  if (rc < 0 && rc != -2) {
1126  SysError("DispatchOneEvent", "select: write error on %d", fd);
1127  fWritemask->Clr(fd);
1128  }
1129  }
1130  t.Clr(fd);
1131  }
1132  }
1133  }
1134 }
1135 
1136 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1137 /// Sleep milliSec milliseconds.
1138 
1139 void TUnixSystem::Sleep(UInt_t milliSec)
1140 {
1141  struct timeval tv;
1142 
1143  tv.tv_sec = milliSec / 1000;
1144  tv.tv_usec = (milliSec % 1000) * 1000;
1145 
1146  select(0, 0, 0, 0, &tv);
1147 }
1148 
1149 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1150 /// Select on file descriptors. The timeout to is in millisec. Returns
1151 /// the number of ready descriptors, or 0 in case of timeout, or < 0 in
1152 /// case of an error, with -2 being EINTR and -3 EBADF. In case of EINTR
1153 /// the errno has been reset and the method can be called again. Returns
1154 /// -4 in case the list did not contain any file handlers or file handlers
1155 /// with file descriptor >= 0.
1156 
1157 Int_t TUnixSystem::Select(TList *act, Long_t to)
1158 {
1159  Int_t rc = -4;
1160 
1161  TFdSet rd, wr;
1162  Int_t mxfd = -1;
1163  TIter next(act);
1164  TFileHandler *h = 0;
1165  while ((h = (TFileHandler *) next())) {
1166  Int_t fd = h->GetFd();
1167  if (fd > -1) {
1168  if (h->HasReadInterest()) {
1169  rd.Set(fd);
1170  mxfd = TMath::Max(mxfd, fd);
1171  }
1172  if (h->HasWriteInterest()) {
1173  wr.Set(fd);
1174  mxfd = TMath::Max(mxfd, fd);
1175  }
1176  h->ResetReadyMask();
1177  }
1178  }
1179  if (mxfd > -1)
1180  rc = UnixSelect(mxfd+1, &rd, &wr, to);
1181 
1182  // Set readiness bits
1183  if (rc > 0) {
1184  next.Reset();
1185  while ((h = (TFileHandler *) next())) {
1186  Int_t fd = h->GetFd();
1187  if (rd.IsSet(fd))
1188  h->SetReadReady();
1189  if (wr.IsSet(fd))
1190  h->SetWriteReady();
1191  }
1192  }
1193 
1194  return rc;
1195 }
1196 
1197 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1198 /// Select on the file descriptor related to file handler h.
1199 /// The timeout to is in millisec. Returns the number of ready descriptors,
1200 /// or 0 in case of timeout, or < 0 in case of an error, with -2 being EINTR
1201 /// and -3 EBADF. In case of EINTR the errno has been reset and the method
1202 /// can be called again. Returns -4 in case the file handler is 0 or does
1203 /// not have a file descriptor >= 0.
1204 
1205 Int_t TUnixSystem::Select(TFileHandler *h, Long_t to)
1206 {
1207  Int_t rc = -4;
1208 
1209  TFdSet rd, wr;
1210  Int_t mxfd = -1;
1211  Int_t fd = -1;
1212  if (h) {
1213  fd = h->GetFd();
1214  if (fd > -1) {
1215  if (h->HasReadInterest())
1216  rd.Set(fd);
1217  if (h->HasWriteInterest())
1218  wr.Set(fd);
1219  h->ResetReadyMask();
1220  mxfd = fd;
1221  rc = UnixSelect(mxfd+1, &rd, &wr, to);
1222  }
1223  }
1224 
1225  // Fill output lists, if required
1226  if (rc > 0) {
1227  if (rd.IsSet(fd))
1228  h->SetReadReady();
1229  if (wr.IsSet(fd))
1230  h->SetWriteReady();
1231  }
1232 
1233  return rc;
1234 }
1235 
1236 //---- handling of system events -----------------------------------------------
1237 
1238 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1239 /// Check if some signals were raised and call their Notify() member.
1240 
1241 Bool_t TUnixSystem::CheckSignals(Bool_t sync)
1242 {
1243  TSignalHandler *sh;
1244  Int_t sigdone = -1;
1245  {
1246  TOrdCollectionIter it((TOrdCollection*)fSignalHandler);
1247 
1248  while ((sh = (TSignalHandler*)it.Next())) {
1249  if (sync == sh->IsSync()) {
1250  ESignals sig = sh->GetSignal();
1251  if ((fSignals->IsSet(sig) && sigdone == -1) || sigdone == sig) {
1252  if (sigdone == -1) {
1253  fSignals->Clr(sig);
1254  sigdone = sig;
1255  fSigcnt--;
1256  }
1257  if (sh->IsActive())
1258  sh->Notify();
1259  }
1260  }
1261  }
1262  }
1263  if (sigdone != -1)
1264  return kTRUE;
1265 
1266  return kFALSE;
1267 }
1268 
1269 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1270 /// Check if children have finished.
1271 
1272 void TUnixSystem::CheckChilds()
1273 {
1274 #if 0 //rdm
1275  int pid;
1276  while ((pid = UnixWaitchild()) > 0) {
1277  TIter next(zombieHandler);
1278  register UnixPtty *pty;
1279  while ((pty = (UnixPtty*) next()))
1280  if (pty->GetPid() == pid) {
1281  zombieHandler->RemovePtr(pty);
1282  pty->DiedNotify();
1283  }
1284  }
1285 #endif
1286 }
1287 
1288 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1289 /// Check if there is activity on some file descriptors and call their
1290 /// Notify() member.
1291 
1292 Bool_t TUnixSystem::CheckDescriptors()
1293 {
1294  TFileHandler *fh;
1295  Int_t fddone = -1;
1296  Bool_t read = kFALSE;
1297  TOrdCollectionIter it((TOrdCollection*)fFileHandler);
1298  while ((fh = (TFileHandler*) it.Next())) {
1299  Int_t fd = fh->GetFd();
1300  if ((fd <= fMaxrfd && fReadready->IsSet(fd) && fddone == -1) ||
1301  (fddone == fd && read)) {
1302  if (fddone == -1) {
1303  fReadready->Clr(fd);
1304  fddone = fd;
1305  read = kTRUE;
1306  fNfd--;
1307  }
1308  if (fh->IsActive())
1309  fh->ReadNotify();
1310  }
1311  if ((fd <= fMaxwfd && fWriteready->IsSet(fd) && fddone == -1) ||
1312  (fddone == fd && !read)) {
1313  if (fddone == -1) {
1314  fWriteready->Clr(fd);
1315  fddone = fd;
1316  read = kFALSE;
1317  fNfd--;
1318  }
1319  if (fh->IsActive())
1320  fh->WriteNotify();
1321  }
1322  }
1323  if (fddone != -1)
1324  return kTRUE;
1325 
1326  return kFALSE;
1327 }
1328

1454 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1455 /// Return a user configured or systemwide directory to create
1456 /// temporary files in.
1457 
1458 const char *TUnixSystem::TempDirectory() const
1459 {

1461  if (!dir || gSystem->AccessPathName(dir, kWritePermission))
1462  dir = "/tmp";
1463

1465 }
1466 
1467 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1468 /// Create a secure temporary file by appending a unique
1469 /// 6 letter string to base. The file will be created in
1470 /// a standard (system) directory or in the directory
1471 /// provided in dir. The full filename is returned in base
1472 /// and a filepointer is returned for safely writing to the file
1473 /// (this avoids certain security problems). Returns 0 in case
1474 /// of error.
1475 
1476 FILE *TUnixSystem::TempFileName(TString &base, const char *dir)
1477 {
1478  char *b = ConcatFileName(dir ? dir : TempDirectory(), base);
1479  base = b;
1480  base += "XXXXXX";
1481  delete [] b;
1482 
1483  char *arg = StrDup(base);
1484  int fd = mkstemp(arg);
1485  base = arg;
1486  delete [] arg;
1487 
1488  if (fd == -1) {
1489  SysError("TempFileName", "%s", base.Data());
1490  return 0;
1491  } else {
1492  FILE *fp = fdopen(fd, "w+");
1493  if (fp == 0)
1494  SysError("TempFileName", "converting filedescriptor (%d)", fd);
1495  return fp;
1496  }
1497 }

1499 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1500 /// Concatenate a directory and a file name.
1501 
1502 const char *TUnixSystem::PrependPathName(const char *dir, TString& name)
1503 {
1504  if (name.IsNull() || name == ".") {
1505  if (dir) {
1506  name = dir;
1507  if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != '/')
1508  name += '/';
1509  } else name = "";
1510  return name.Data();
1511  }
1512 
1513  if (!dir || !dir[0]) dir = "/";
1514  else if (dir[strlen(dir) - 1] != '/')
1515  name.Prepend('/');
1516  name.Prepend(dir);
1517 
1518  return name.Data();
1519 }

1523 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1524 /// Returns FALSE if one can access a file using the specified access mode.
1525 /// Mode is the same as for the Unix access(2) function.
1526 /// Attention, bizarre convention of return value!!
1527 
1528 Bool_t TUnixSystem::AccessPathName(const char *path, EAccessMode mode)
1529 {
1530  TSystem *helper = FindHelper(path);
1531  if (helper)
1532  return helper->AccessPathName(path, mode);
1533 
1534  if (::access(StripOffProto(path, "file:"), mode) == 0)
1535  return kFALSE;
1536  GetLastErrorString() = GetError();
1537 
1538  return kTRUE;
1539 }
1540 
1541 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1542 /// Copy a file. If overwrite is true and file already exists the
1543 /// file will be overwritten. Returns 0 when successful, -1 in case
1544 /// of file open failure, -2 in case the file already exists and overwrite
1545 /// was false and -3 in case of error during copy.
1546 
1547 int TUnixSystem::CopyFile(const char *f, const char *t, Bool_t overwrite)
1548 {
1549  if (!AccessPathName(t) && !overwrite)
1550  return -2;
1551 
1552  FILE *from = fopen(f, "r");
1553  if (!from)
1554  return -1;
1555 
1556  FILE *to = fopen(t, "w");
1557  if (!to) {
1558  fclose(from);
1559  return -1;
1560  }
1561 
1562  const int bufsize = 1024;
1563  char buf[bufsize];
1564  int ret = 0;
1565  while (!ret && !feof(from)) {
1566  size_t numread = fread (buf, sizeof(char), bufsize, from);
1567  size_t numwritten = fwrite(buf, sizeof(char), numread, to);
1568  if (numread != numwritten)
1569  ret = -3;
1570  }
1571 
1572  fclose(from);
1573  fclose(to);
1574 
1575  return ret;
1576 }
1577

1579 /// Rename a file. Returns 0 when successful, -1 in case of failure.
1580 
1581 int TUnixSystem::Rename(const char *f, const char *t)
1582 {
1583  int ret = ::rename(f, t);
1584  GetLastErrorString() = GetError();
1585  return ret;
1586 }

1653 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1654 /// Unlink, i.e. remove, a file or directory. Returns 0 when successful,
1655 /// -1 in case of failure.
1656 
1657 int TUnixSystem::Unlink(const char *name)
1658 {
1659  TSystem *helper = FindHelper(name);
1660  if (helper)
1661  return helper->Unlink(name);
1662 
1663 #if defined(R__SEEK64)
1664  struct stat64 finfo;
1665  if (lstat64(name, &finfo) < 0)
1666 #else
1667  struct stat finfo;
1668  if (lstat(name, &finfo) < 0)
1669 #endif
1670  return -1;
1671 
1672  if (S_ISDIR(finfo.st_mode))
1673  return ::rmdir(name);
1674  else
1675  return ::unlink(name);
1676 }
1677 
1678 //---- expand the metacharacters as in the shell -------------------------------
1679 
1680 // expand the metacharacters as in the shell
1681 
1682 const char
1683 #ifdef G__OLDEXPAND
1684  kShellEscape = '\\',
1685  *kShellStuff = "(){}<>\"'",
1686 #endif
1687  *kShellMeta = "~*[]{}?$";
1688 
1689 
1690 #ifndef G__OLDEXPAND
1691 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1692 /// Expand a pathname getting rid of special shell characters like ~.$, etc.
1693 /// For Unix/Win32 compatibility use $(XXX) instead of $XXX when using
1694 /// environment variables in a pathname. If compatibility is not an issue
1695 /// you can use on Unix directly $XXX. Returns kFALSE in case of success
1696 /// or kTRUE in case of error.
1697 
1698 Bool_t TUnixSystem::ExpandPathName(TString &path)
1699 {
1700  const char *p, *patbuf = (const char *)path;
1701 
1702  // skip leading blanks
1703  while (*patbuf == ' ')
1704  patbuf++;
1705 
1706  // any shell meta characters ?
1707  for (p = patbuf; *p; p++)
1708  if (strchr(kShellMeta, *p))
1709  goto expand;
1710 
1711  return kFALSE;
1712 
1713 expand:
1714  // replace $(XXX) by $XXX
1715  path.ReplaceAll("$(","$");
1716  path.ReplaceAll(")","");
1717 
1718  return ExpandFileName(path);
1719 }
1720 #endif
1721 
1722 #ifdef G__OLDEXPAND
1723 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1724 /// Expand a pathname getting rid of special shell characters like ~.$, etc.
1725 /// For Unix/Win32 compatibility use $(XXX) instead of $XXX when using
1726 /// environment variables in a pathname. If compatibility is not an issue
1727 /// you can use on Unix directly $XXX. Returns kFALSE in case of success
1728 /// or kTRUE in case of error.
1729 
1730 Bool_t TUnixSystem::ExpandPathName(TString &patbuf0)
1731 {
1732  const char *patbuf = (const char *)patbuf0;
1733  const char *hd, *p;
1734  // char cmd[kMAXPATHLEN],
1735  char stuffedPat[kMAXPATHLEN], name[70];
1736  char *q;
1737  FILE *pf;
1738  int ch;
1739 
1740  // skip leading blanks
1741  while (*patbuf == ' ')
1742  patbuf++;
1743 
1744  // any shell meta characters ?
1745  for (p = patbuf; *p; p++)
1746  if (strchr(kShellMeta, *p))
1747  goto needshell;
1748 
1749  return kFALSE;
1750 
1751 needshell:
1752  // replace $(XXX) by $XXX
1753  patbuf0.ReplaceAll("$(","$");
1754  patbuf0.ReplaceAll(")","");
1755 
1756  // escape shell quote characters
1757  EscChar(patbuf, stuffedPat, sizeof(stuffedPat), (char*)kShellStuff, kShellEscape);
1758 
1759  TString cmd("echo ");
1760 
1761  // emulate csh -> popen executes sh
1762  if (stuffedPat[0] == '~') {
1763  if (stuffedPat[1] != '\0' && stuffedPat[1] != '/') {
1764  // extract user name
1765  for (p = &stuffedPat[1], q = name; *p && *p !='/';)
1766  *q++ = *p++;
1767  *q = '\0';
1768  hd = UnixHomedirectory(name);
1769  if (hd == 0)
1770  cmd += stuffedPat;
1771  else {
1772  cmd += hd;
1773  cmd += p;
1774  }
1775  } else {
1776  hd = UnixHomedirectory(0);
1777  if (hd == 0) {
1778  GetLastErrorString() = GetError();
1779  return kTRUE;
1780  }
1781  cmd += hd;
1782  cmd += &stuffedPat[1];
1783  }
1784  } else
1785  cmd += stuffedPat;
1786 
1787  if ((pf = ::popen(cmd.Data(), "r")) == 0) {
1788  GetLastErrorString() = GetError();
1789  return kTRUE;
1790  }
1791 
1792  // read first argument
1793  patbuf0 = "";
1794  int cnt = 0;
1795 #if defined(R__AIX)
1796 again:
1797 #endif
1798  for (ch = fgetc(pf); ch != EOF && ch != ' ' && ch != '\n'; ch = fgetc(pf)) {
1799  patbuf0.Append(ch);
1800  cnt++;
1801  }
1802 #if defined(R__AIX)
1803  // Work around bug timing problem due to delay in forking a large program
1804  if (cnt == 0 && ch == EOF) goto again;
1805 #endif
1806 
1807  // skip rest of pipe
1808  while (ch != EOF) {
1809  ch = fgetc(pf);
1810  if (ch == ' ' || ch == '\t') {
1811  GetLastErrorString() = "expression ambigous";
1812  ::pclose(pf);
1813  return kTRUE;
1814  }
1815  }
1816 
1817  ::pclose(pf);
1818 
1819  return kFALSE;
1820 }
1821 #endif
1822 
1823 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1824 /// Expand a pathname getting rid of special shell characaters like ~.$, etc.
1825 /// For Unix/Win32 compatibility use $(XXX) instead of $XXX when using
1826 /// environment variables in a pathname. If compatibility is not an issue
1827 /// you can use on Unix directly $XXX. The user must delete returned string.
1828 /// Returns the expanded pathname or 0 in case of error.
1829 /// The user must delete returned string (delete []).
1830 
1831 char *TUnixSystem::ExpandPathName(const char *path)
1832 {
1833  TString patbuf = path;
1834  if (ExpandPathName(patbuf))
1835  return 0;
1836  return StrDup(patbuf.Data());
1837 }

1855 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1856 /// Set a files modification and access times. If actime = 0 it will be
1857 /// set to the modtime. Returns 0 on success and -1 in case of error.
1858 
1859 int TUnixSystem::Utime(const char *file, Long_t modtime, Long_t actime)
1860 {
1861  if (!actime)
1862  actime = modtime;
1863 
1864  struct utimbuf t;
1865  t.actime = (time_t)actime;
1866  t.modtime = (time_t)modtime;
1867  return ::utime(file, &t);
1868 }
1869 
1870 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1871 /// Find location of file "wfil" in a search path.
1872 /// The search path is specified as a : separated list of directories.
1873 /// Return value is pointing to wfile for compatibility with
1874 /// Which(const char*,const char*,EAccessMode) version.
1875 
1876 const char *TUnixSystem::FindFile(const char *search, TString& wfil, EAccessMode mode)
1877 {
1878  TString show;
1879  if (gEnv->GetValue("Root.ShowPath", 0))
1880  show.Form("Which: %s =", wfil.Data());
1881 
1882  gSystem->ExpandPathName(wfil);
1883 
1884  if (wfil[0] == '/') {
1885 #if defined(R__SEEK64)
1886  struct stat64 finfo;
1887  if (access(wfil.Data(), mode) == 0 &&
1888  stat64(wfil.Data(), &finfo) == 0 && S_ISREG(finfo.st_mode)) {
1889 #else
1890  struct stat finfo;
1891  if (access(wfil.Data(), mode) == 0 &&
1892  stat(wfil.Data(), &finfo) == 0 && S_ISREG(finfo.st_mode)) {
1893 #endif
1894  if (show != "")
1895  Printf("%s %s", show.Data(), wfil.Data());
1896  return wfil.Data();
1897  }
1898  if (show != "")
1899  Printf("%s <not found>", show.Data());
1900  wfil = "";
1901  return 0;
1902  }
1903 
1904  if (search == 0)
1905  search = ".";
1906 
1907  TString apwd(gSystem->WorkingDirectory());
1908  apwd += "/";
1909  for (const char* ptr = search; *ptr;) {
1910  TString name;
1911  if (*ptr != '/' && *ptr !='$' && *ptr != '~')
1912  name = apwd;
1913  const char* posEndOfPart = strchr(ptr, ':');
1914  if (posEndOfPart) {
1915  name.Append(ptr, posEndOfPart - ptr);
1916  ptr = posEndOfPart + 1; // skip ':'
1917  } else {
1918  name.Append(ptr);
1919  ptr += strlen(ptr);
1920  }
1921 
1922  if (!name.EndsWith("/"))
1923  name += '/';
1924  name += wfil;
1925 
1926  gSystem->ExpandPathName(name);
1927 #if defined(R__SEEK64)
1928  struct stat64 finfo;
1929  if (access(name.Data(), mode) == 0 &&
1930  stat64(name.Data(), &finfo) == 0 && S_ISREG(finfo.st_mode)) {
1931 #else
1932  struct stat finfo;
1933  if (access(name.Data(), mode) == 0 &&
1934  stat(name.Data(), &finfo) == 0 && S_ISREG(finfo.st_mode)) {
1935 #endif
1936  if (show != "")
1937  Printf("%s %s", show.Data(), name.Data());
1938  wfil = name;
1939  return wfil.Data();
1940  }
1941  }
1942 
1943  if (show != "")
1944  Printf("%s <not found>", show.Data());
1945  wfil = "";
1946  return 0;
1947 }

1951 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1952 /// Returns the user's id. If user = 0, returns current user's id.
1953 
1954 Int_t TUnixSystem::GetUid(const char *user)
1955 {
1956  if (!user || !user[0])
1957  return getuid();
1958  else {
1959  struct passwd *apwd = getpwnam(user);
1960  if (apwd)
1961  return apwd->pw_uid;
1962  }
1963  return 0;
1964 }

1968 /// set id bit on the file being executed.
1969 
1970 Int_t TUnixSystem::GetEffectiveUid()
1971 {
1972  return geteuid();
1973 }

1975 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1976 /// Returns the group's id. If group = 0, returns current user's group.
1977 
1978 Int_t TUnixSystem::GetGid(const char *group)
1979 {
1980  if (!group || !group[0])
1981  return getgid();
1982  else {
1983  struct group *grp = getgrnam(group);
1984  if (grp)
1985  return grp->gr_gid;
1986  }
1987  return 0;
1988 }

1990 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1991 /// Returns the effective group id. The effective group id corresponds

1994 Int_t TUnixSystem::GetEffectiveGid()
1995 {

1997 }
1998 
1999 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2000 /// Returns all user info in the UserGroup_t structure. The returned
2001 /// structure must be deleted by the user. In case of error 0 is returned.
2002 
2003 UserGroup_t *TUnixSystem::GetUserInfo(Int_t uid)
2004 {
2005  typedef std::map<Int_t /*uid*/, UserGroup_t> UserInfoCache_t;
2006  static UserInfoCache_t gUserInfo;
2007 
2008  UserInfoCache_t::const_iterator iUserInfo = gUserInfo.find(uid);
2009  if (iUserInfo != gUserInfo.end())
2010  return new UserGroup_t(iUserInfo->second);
2011 
2012  struct passwd *apwd = getpwuid(uid);
2013  if (apwd) {
2014  UserGroup_t *ug = new UserGroup_t;
2015  ug->fUid = apwd->pw_uid;
2016  ug->fGid = apwd->pw_gid;
2017  ug->fUser = apwd->pw_name;
2018  ug->fPasswd = apwd->pw_passwd;
2019  ug->fRealName = apwd->pw_gecos;
2020  ug->fShell = apwd->pw_shell;
2021  UserGroup_t *gr = GetGroupInfo(apwd->pw_gid);
2022  if (gr) ug->fGroup = gr->fGroup;
2023  delete gr;
2024 
2025  gUserInfo[uid] = *ug;
2026  return ug;
2027  }
2028  return 0;
2029 }
2030 
2031 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2032 /// Returns all user info in the UserGroup_t structure. If user = 0, returns
2033 /// current user's id info. The returned structure must be deleted by the
2034 /// user. In case of error 0 is returned.
2035 
2036 UserGroup_t *TUnixSystem::GetUserInfo(const char *user)
2037 {
2038  return GetUserInfo(GetUid(user));
2039 }
2040 
2041 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2042 /// Returns all group info in the UserGroup_t structure. The only active
2043 /// fields in the UserGroup_t structure for this call are:
2044 /// fGid and fGroup
2045 /// The returned structure must be deleted by the user. In case of
2046 /// error 0 is returned.
2047 
2048 UserGroup_t *TUnixSystem::GetGroupInfo(Int_t gid)
2049 {
2050  struct group *grp = getgrgid(gid);
2051  if (grp) {
2052  UserGroup_t *gr = new UserGroup_t;
2053  gr->fUid = 0;
2054  gr->fGid = grp->gr_gid;
2055  gr->fGroup = grp->gr_name;
2056  return gr;
2057  }
2058  return 0;
2059 }
2060 
2061 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2062 /// Returns all group info in the UserGroup_t structure. The only active
2063 /// fields in the UserGroup_t structure for this call are:
2064 /// fGid and fGroup
2065 /// If group = 0, returns current user's group. The returned structure
2066 /// must be deleted by the user. In case of error 0 is returned.
2067 
2068 UserGroup_t *TUnixSystem::GetGroupInfo(const char *group)
2069 {
2070  return GetGroupInfo(GetGid(group));
2071 }

2161 #ifdef R__MACOSX
2162 /// Use CoreSymbolication to retrieve the stacktrace.
2163 #include <mach/mach.h>
2164 extern "C" {
2165  // Adapted from https://github.com/mountainstorm/CoreSymbolication
2166  // Under the hood the framework basically just calls through to a set of C++ libraries
2167  typedef struct {
2168  void* csCppData;
2169  void* csCppObj;
2170  } CSTypeRef;
2171  typedef CSTypeRef CSSymbolicatorRef;
2172  typedef CSTypeRef CSSourceInfoRef;
2173  typedef CSTypeRef CSSymbolOwnerRef;
2174  typedef CSTypeRef CSSymbolRef;
2175 
2176  CSSymbolicatorRef CSSymbolicatorCreateWithPid(pid_t pid);
2177  CSSymbolRef CSSymbolicatorGetSymbolWithAddressAtTime(CSSymbolicatorRef cs, vm_address_t addr, uint64_t time);
2178  CSSourceInfoRef CSSymbolicatorGetSourceInfoWithAddressAtTime(CSSymbolicatorRef cs, vm_address_t addr, uint64_t time);
2179  const char* CSSymbolGetName(CSSymbolRef sym);
2180  CSSymbolOwnerRef CSSymbolGetSymbolOwner(CSSymbolRef sym);
2181  const char* CSSymbolOwnerGetPath(CSSymbolOwnerRef symbol);
2182  const char* CSSourceInfoGetPath(CSSourceInfoRef info);
2183  int CSSourceInfoGetLineNumber(CSSourceInfoRef info);
2184 }
2185 
2186 bool CSTypeRefIdValid(CSTypeRef ref) {
2187  return ref.csCppData || ref.csCppObj;
2188 }
2189 
2190 void macosx_backtrace() {
2191 void* addrlist[kMAX_BACKTRACE_DEPTH];
2192  // retrieve current stack addresses
2193  int numstacks = backtrace( addrlist, sizeof( addrlist ) / sizeof( void* ));
2194 
2195  CSSymbolicatorRef symbolicator = CSSymbolicatorCreateWithPid(getpid());
2196 
2197  // skip TUnixSystem::Backtrace(), macosx_backtrace()
2198  static const int skipFrames = 2;
2199  for (int i = skipFrames; i < numstacks; ++i) {
2200  // No debug info, try to get at least the symbol name.
2201  CSSymbolRef sym = CSSymbolicatorGetSymbolWithAddressAtTime(symbolicator,
2202  (vm_address_t)addrlist[i],
2203  0x80000000u);
2204  CSSymbolOwnerRef symOwner = CSSymbolGetSymbolOwner(sym);
2205 
2206  if (const char* libPath = CSSymbolOwnerGetPath(symOwner)) {
2207  printf("[%s]", libPath);
2208  } else {
2209  printf("[<unknown binary>]");
2210  }
2211 
2212  if (const char* symname = CSSymbolGetName(sym)) {
2213  printf(" %s", symname);
2214  }
2215 
2216  CSSourceInfoRef sourceInfo
2217  = CSSymbolicatorGetSourceInfoWithAddressAtTime(symbolicator,
2218  (vm_address_t)addrlist[i],
2219  0x80000000u /*"now"*/);
2220  if (const char* sourcePath = CSSourceInfoGetPath(sourceInfo)) {
2221  printf(" %s:%d", sourcePath, (int)CSSourceInfoGetLineNumber(sourceInfo));
2222  } else {
2223  printf(" (no debug info)");
2224  }
2225  printf("\n");
2226  }
2227 }
2228 #endif // R__MACOSX
2229 
2230 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2231 /// Print a stack trace.
2232 
2233 void TUnixSystem::StackTrace()
2234 {
2235  if (!gEnv->GetValue("Root.Stacktrace", 1))
2236  return;
2237 
2238 #ifndef R__MACOSX
2239  TString gdbscript = gEnv->GetValue("Root.StacktraceScript", "");
2240  gdbscript = gdbscript.Strip();
2241  if (gdbscript != "") {
2242  if (AccessPathName(gdbscript, kReadPermission)) {
2243  fprintf(stderr, "Root.StacktraceScript %s does not exist\n", gdbscript.Data());
2244  gdbscript = "";
2245  }
2246  }
2247  if (gdbscript == "") {
2248  gdbscript = "gdb-backtrace.sh";
2249  gSystem->PrependPathName(TROOT::GetEtcDir(), gdbscript);
2250  if (AccessPathName(gdbscript, kReadPermission)) {
2251  fprintf(stderr, "Error in <TUnixSystem::StackTrace> script %s is missing\n", gdbscript.Data());
2252  return;
2253  }
2254  }
2255  gdbscript += " ";
2256 
2257  TString gdbmess = gEnv->GetValue("Root.StacktraceMessage", "");
2258  gdbmess = gdbmess.Strip();
2259 
2260  std::cout.flush();
2261  fflush(stdout);
2262 
2263  std::cerr.flush();
2264  fflush(stderr);
2265 
2266  int fd = STDERR_FILENO;
2267 
2268  const char *message = " Generating stack trace...\n";
2269 
2270  if (fd && message) { } // remove unused warning (remove later)
2271 
2272  if (gApplication && !strcmp(gApplication->GetName(), "TRint"))
2273  Getlinem(kCleanUp, 0);
2274 
2275 #if defined(USE_GDB_STACK_TRACE)
2276  char *gdb = Which(Getenv("PATH"), "gdb", kExecutePermission);
2277  if (!gdb) {
2278  fprintf(stderr, "gdb not found, need it for stack trace\n");
2279  return;
2280  }
2281 
2282  // write custom message file
2283  TString gdbmessf = "gdb-message";
2284  if (gdbmess != "") {
2285  FILE *f = TempFileName(gdbmessf);
2286  fprintf(f, "%s\n", gdbmess.Data());
2287  fclose(f);
2288  }
2289 
2290  // use gdb to get stack trace
2291  gdbscript += GetExePath();
2292  gdbscript += " ";
2293  gdbscript += GetPid();
2294  if (gdbmess != "") {
2295  gdbscript += " ";
2296  gdbscript += gdbmessf;
2297  }
2298  gdbscript += " 1>&2";
2299  Exec(gdbscript);
2300  delete [] gdb;
2301  return;
2302 
2303 #elif defined(R__AIX)
2304  TString script = "procstack ";
2305  script += GetPid();
2306  Exec(script);
2307  return;
2308 #elif defined(R__SOLARIS)
2309  char *cppfilt = Which(Getenv("PATH"), "c++filt", kExecutePermission);
2310  TString script = "pstack ";
2311  script += GetPid();
2312  if (cppfilt) {
2313  script += " | ";
2314  script += cppfilt;
2315  delete [] cppfilt;
2316  }
2317  Exec(script);
2318  return;
2319 #elif defined(HAVE_BACKTRACE_SYMBOLS_FD) && defined(HAVE_DLADDR) // linux + MacOS X >= 10.5
2320  // we could have used backtrace_symbols_fd, except its output
2321  // format is pretty bad, so recode that here :-(
2322 
2323  // take care of demangling
2324  Bool_t demangle = kTRUE;
2325 
2326  // check for c++filt
2327  const char *cppfilt = "c++filt";
2328  const char *cppfiltarg = "";
2329 #ifdef R__B64
2330  const char *format1 = " 0x%016lx in %.200s %s 0x%lx from %.200s\n";
2331 #ifdef R__MACOSX
2332  const char *format2 = " 0x%016lx in %.200s\n";
2333 #else
2334  const char *format2 = " 0x%016lx in %.200s at %.200s from %.200s\n";
2335 #endif
2336  const char *format3 = " 0x%016lx in %.200s from %.200s\n";
2337  const char *format4 = " 0x%016lx in <unknown function>\n";
2338 #else
2339  const char *format1 = " 0x%08lx in %.200s %s 0x%lx from %.200s\n";
2340 #ifdef R__MACOSX
2341  const char *format2 = " 0x%08lx in %.200s\n";
2342 #else
2343  const char *format2 = " 0x%08lx in %.200s at %.200s from %.200s\n";
2344 #endif
2345  const char *format3 = " 0x%08lx in %.200s from %.200s\n";
2346  const char *format4 = " 0x%08lx in <unknown function>\n";
2347 #endif
2348 
2349  char *filter = Which(Getenv("PATH"), cppfilt, kExecutePermission);
2350  if (!filter)
2351  demangle = kFALSE;
2352 
2353 #if (__GNUC__ >= 3)
2354  // try finding supported format option for g++ v3
2355  if (filter) {
2356  FILE *p = OpenPipe(TString::Format("%s --help 2>&1", filter), "r");
2357  TString help;
2358  while (help.Gets(p)) {
2359  if (help.Index("gnu-v3") != kNPOS) {
2360  cppfiltarg = "--format=gnu-v3";
2361  break;
2362  } else if (help.Index("gnu-new-abi") != kNPOS) {
2363  cppfiltarg = "--format=gnu-new-abi";
2364  break;
2365  }
2366  }
2367  ClosePipe(p);
2368  }
2369 #endif
2370  // gdb-backtrace.sh uses gdb to produce a backtrace. See if it is available.
2371  // If it is, use it. If not proceed as before.
2372 #if (defined(R__LINUX) && !defined(R__WINGCC))
2373  // Declare the process that will be generating the stacktrace
2374  // For more see: http://askubuntu.com/questions/41629/after-upgrade-gdb-wont-attach-to-process
2375 #ifdef PR_SET_PTRACER
2376  prctl(PR_SET_PTRACER, getpid(), 0, 0, 0);
2377 #endif
2378 #endif
2379  char *gdb = Which(Getenv("PATH"), "gdb", kExecutePermission);
2380  if (gdb) {
2381  // write custom message file
2382  TString gdbmessf = "gdb-message";
2383  if (gdbmess != "") {
2384  FILE *f = TempFileName(gdbmessf);
2385  fprintf(f, "%s\n", gdbmess.Data());
2386  fclose(f);
2387  }
2388 
2389  // use gdb to get stack trace
2390 #ifdef R__MACOSX
2391  gdbscript += GetExePath();
2392  gdbscript += " ";
2393 #endif
2394  gdbscript += GetPid();
2395  if (gdbmess != "") {
2396  gdbscript += " ";
2397  gdbscript += gdbmessf;
2398  }
2399  gdbscript += " 1>&2";
2400  Exec(gdbscript);
2401  delete [] gdb;
2402  } else {
2403  // addr2line uses debug info to convert addresses into file names
2404  // and line numbers
2405 #ifdef R__MACOSX
2406  char *addr2line = Which(Getenv("PATH"), "atos", kExecutePermission);
2407 #else
2408  char *addr2line = Which(Getenv("PATH"), "addr2line", kExecutePermission);
2409 #endif
2410  if (addr2line) {
2411  // might take some time so tell what we are doing...
2412  if (write(fd, message, strlen(message)) < 0)
2413  Warning("StackTrace", "problems writing line numbers (errno: %d)", TSystem::GetErrno());
2414  }
2415 
2416  // open tmp file for demangled stack trace
2417  TString tmpf1 = "gdb-backtrace";
2418  std::ofstream file1;
2419  if (demangle) {
2420  FILE *f = TempFileName(tmpf1);
2421  if (f) fclose(f);
2422  file1.open(tmpf1);
2423  if (!file1) {
2424  Error("StackTrace", "could not open file %s", tmpf1.Data());
2425  Unlink(tmpf1);
2426  demangle = kFALSE;
2427  }
2428  }
2429 
2430 #ifdef R__MACOSX
2431  if (addr2line)
2432  demangle = kFALSE; // atos always demangles
2433 #endif
2434 
2435  char buffer[4096];
2436  void *trace[kMAX_BACKTRACE_DEPTH];
2437  int depth = backtrace(trace, kMAX_BACKTRACE_DEPTH);
2438  for (int n = 5; n < depth; n++) {
2439  ULong_t addr = (ULong_t) trace[n];
2440  Dl_info info;
2441 
2442  if (dladdr(trace[n], &info) && info.dli_fname && info.dli_fname[0]) {
2443  const char *libname = info.dli_fname;
2444  const char *symname = (info.dli_sname && info.dli_sname[0]) ?
2445  info.dli_sname : "<unknown>";
2446  ULong_t libaddr = (ULong_t) info.dli_fbase;
2447  ULong_t symaddr = (ULong_t) info.dli_saddr;
2448  Bool_t gte = (addr >= symaddr);
2449  ULong_t diff = (gte) ? addr - symaddr : symaddr - addr;
2450  if (addr2line && symaddr) {
2451  Bool_t nodebug = kTRUE;
2452 #ifdef R__MACOSX
2453  if (libaddr) { } // use libaddr
2454 #if defined(MAC_OS_X_VERSION_10_10)
2455  snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), "%s -p %d 0x%016lx", addr2line, GetPid(), addr);
2456 #elif defined(MAC_OS_X_VERSION_10_9)
2457  // suppress deprecation warning with opti
2458  snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), "%s -d -p %d 0x%016lx", addr2line, GetPid(), addr);
2459 #else
2460  snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), "%s -p %d 0x%016lx", addr2line, GetPid(), addr);
2461 #endif
2462 #else
2463  ULong_t offset = (addr >= libaddr) ? addr - libaddr :
2464  libaddr - addr;
2465  TString name = TString(libname);
2466  Bool_t noPath = kFALSE;
2467  Bool_t noShare = kTRUE;
2468  if (name[0] != '/') noPath = kTRUE;
2469  if (name.Contains(".so") || name.Contains(".sl")) noShare = kFALSE;
2470  if (noShare) offset = addr;
2471  if (noPath) name = "`which " + name + "`";
2472  snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), "%s -e %s 0x%016lx", addr2line, name.Data(), offset);
2473 #endif
2474  if (FILE *pf = ::popen(buffer, "r")) {
2475  char buf[2048];
2476  if (fgets(buf, 2048, pf)) {
2477  buf[strlen(buf)-1] = 0; // remove trailing \n
2478  if (strncmp(buf, "??", 2)) {
2479 #ifdef R__MACOSX
2480  snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), format2, addr, buf);
2481 #else
2482  snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), format2, addr, symname, buf, libname);
2483 #endif
2484  nodebug = kFALSE;
2485  }
2486  }
2487  ::pclose(pf);
2488  }
2489  if (nodebug)
2490  snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), format1, addr, symname,
2491  gte ? "+" : "-", diff, libname);
2492  } else {
2493  if (symaddr)
2494  snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), format1, addr, symname,
2495  gte ? "+" : "-", diff, libname);
2496  else
2497  snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), format3, addr, symname, libname);
2498  }
2499  } else {
2500  snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), format4, addr);
2501  }
2502 
2503  if (demangle)
2504  file1 << buffer;
2505  else
2506  if (write(fd, buffer, ::strlen(buffer)) < 0)
2507  Warning("StackTrace", "problems writing buffer (errno: %d)", TSystem::GetErrno());
2508  }
2509 
2510  if (demangle) {
2511  TString tmpf2 = "gdb-backtrace";
2512  FILE *f = TempFileName(tmpf2);
2513  if (f) fclose(f);
2514  file1.close();
2515  snprintf(buffer, sizeof(buffer), "%s %s < %s > %s", filter, cppfiltarg, tmpf1.Data(), tmpf2.Data());
2516  Exec(buffer);
2517  std::ifstream file2(tmpf2);
2518  TString line;
2519  while (file2) {
2520  line = "";
2521  line.ReadString(file2);
2522  if (write(fd, line.Data(), line.Length()) < 0)
2523  Warning("StackTrace", "problems writing line (errno: %d)", TSystem::GetErrno());
2524  }
2525  file2.close();
2526  Unlink(tmpf1);
2527  Unlink(tmpf2);
2528  }
2529 
2530  delete [] addr2line;
2531  }
2532  delete [] filter;
2533 #elif defined(HAVE_EXCPT_H) && defined(HAVE_PDSC_H) && \
2534  defined(HAVE_RLD_INTERFACE_H) // tru64
2535  // Tru64 stack walk. Uses the exception handling library and the
2536  // run-time linker's core functions (loader(5)). FIXME: Tru64
2537  // should have _RLD_DLADDR like IRIX below. Verify and update.
2538 
2539  char buffer [128];
2540  sigcontext context;
2541  int rc = 0;
2542 
2543  exc_capture_context (&context);
2544  while (!rc && context.sc_pc) {
2545  // FIXME: Elf32?
2546  pdsc_crd *func, *base, *crd
2547  = exc_remote_lookup_function_entry(0, 0, context.sc_pc, 0, &func, &base);
2548  Elf32_Addr addr = PDSC_CRD_BEGIN_ADDRESS(base, func);
2549  // const char *name = _rld_address_to_name(addr);
2550  const char *name = "<unknown function>";
2551  sprintf(buffer, " 0x%012lx %.200s + 0x%lx\n",
2552  context.sc_pc, name, context.sc_pc - addr);
2553  write(fd, buffer, ::strlen(buffer));
2554  rc = exc_virtual_unwind(0, &context);
2555  }
2556 #endif
2557 #else //R__MACOSX
2558  macosx_backtrace();
2559 #endif //R__MACOSX
2560 }

2564 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2565 /// Open connection to system log daemon. For the use of the options and
2566 /// facility see the Unix openlog man page.
2567 
2568 void TUnixSystem::Openlog(const char *name, Int_t options, ELogFacility facility)
2569 {
2570  int fac = 0;
2571 
2572  switch (facility) {
2573  case kLogLocal0:
2574  fac = LOG_LOCAL0;
2575  break;
2576  case kLogLocal1:
2577  fac = LOG_LOCAL1;
2578  break;
2579  case kLogLocal2:
2580  fac = LOG_LOCAL2;
2581  break;
2582  case kLogLocal3:
2583  fac = LOG_LOCAL3;
2584  break;
2585  case kLogLocal4:
2586  fac = LOG_LOCAL4;
2587  break;
2588  case kLogLocal5:
2589  fac = LOG_LOCAL5;
2590  break;
2591  case kLogLocal6:
2592  fac = LOG_LOCAL6;
2593  break;
2594  case kLogLocal7:
2595  fac = LOG_LOCAL7;
2596  break;
2597  }
2598 
2599  ::openlog(name, options, fac);
2600 }

2620 //---- Standard output redirection ---------------------------------------------
2621 
2622 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2623 /// Redirect standard output (stdout, stderr) to the specified file.
2624 /// If the file argument is 0 the output is set again to stderr, stdout.
2625 /// The second argument specifies whether the output should be added to the
2626 /// file ("a", default) or the file be truncated before ("w").
2627 /// This function saves internally the current state into a static structure.
2628 /// The call can be made reentrant by specifying the opaque structure pointed
2629 /// by 'h', which is filled with the relevant information. The handle 'h'
2630 /// obtained on the first call must then be used in any subsequent call,
2631 /// included ShowOutput, to display the redirected output.
2632 /// Returns 0 on success, -1 in case of error.
2633 
2634 Int_t TUnixSystem::RedirectOutput(const char *file, const char *mode,
2635  RedirectHandle_t *h)
2636 {
2637  // Instance to be used if the caller does not passes 'h'
2638  static RedirectHandle_t loch;
2639 
2640  Int_t rc = 0;
2641 
2642  // Which handle to use ?
2643  RedirectHandle_t *xh = (h) ? h : &loch;
2644 
2645  if (file) {
2646  // Save the paths
2647  Bool_t outdone = kFALSE;
2648  if (xh->fStdOutTty.IsNull()) {
2649  const char *tty = ttyname(STDOUT_FILENO);
2650  if (tty) {
2651  xh->fStdOutTty = tty;
2652  } else {
2653  if ((xh->fStdOutDup = dup(STDOUT_FILENO)) < 0) {
2654  SysError("RedirectOutput", "could not 'dup' stdout (errno: %d)", TSystem::GetErrno());
2655  return -1;
2656  }
2657  outdone = kTRUE;
2658  }
2659  }
2660  if (xh->fStdErrTty.IsNull()) {
2661  const char *tty = ttyname(STDERR_FILENO);
2662  if (tty) {
2663  xh->fStdErrTty = tty;
2664  } else {
2665  if ((xh->fStdErrDup = dup(STDERR_FILENO)) < 0) {
2666  SysError("RedirectOutput", "could not 'dup' stderr (errno: %d)", TSystem::GetErrno());
2667  if (outdone && dup2(xh->fStdOutDup, STDOUT_FILENO) < 0) {
2668  Warning("RedirectOutput", "could not restore stdout (back to original redirected"
2669  " file) (errno: %d)", TSystem::GetErrno());
2670  }
2671  return -1;
2672  }
2673  }
2674  }
2675 
2676  // Make sure mode makes sense; default "a"
2677  const char *m = (mode[0] == 'a' || mode[0] == 'w') ? mode : "a";
2678 
2679  // Current file size
2680  xh->fReadOffSet = 0;
2681  if (m[0] == 'a') {
2682  // If the file exists, save the current size
2683  FileStat_t st;
2684  if (!gSystem->GetPathInfo(file, st))
2685  xh->fReadOffSet = (st.fSize > 0) ? st.fSize : xh->fReadOffSet;
2686  }
2687  xh->fFile = file;
2688 
2689  // Redirect stdout & stderr
2690  if (freopen(file, m, stdout) == 0) {
2691  SysError("RedirectOutput", "could not freopen stdout (errno: %d)", TSystem::GetErrno());
2692  return -1;
2693  }
2694  if (freopen(file, m, stderr) == 0) {
2695  SysError("RedirectOutput", "could not freopen stderr (errno: %d)", TSystem::GetErrno());
2696  if (freopen(xh->fStdOutTty.Data(), "a", stdout) == 0)
2697  SysError("RedirectOutput", "could not restore stdout (errno: %d)", TSystem::GetErrno());
2698  return -1;
2699  }
2700  } else {
2701  // Restore stdout & stderr
2702  fflush(stdout);
2703  if (!(xh->fStdOutTty.IsNull())) {
2704  if (freopen(xh->fStdOutTty.Data(), "a", stdout) == 0) {
2705  SysError("RedirectOutput", "could not restore stdout (errno: %d)", TSystem::GetErrno());
2706  rc = -1;
2707  }
2708  xh->fStdOutTty = "";
2709  } else {
2710  if (close(STDOUT_FILENO) != 0) {
2711  SysError("RedirectOutput",
2712  "problems closing STDOUT_FILENO (%d) before 'dup2' (errno: %d)",
2713  STDOUT_FILENO, TSystem::GetErrno());
2714  rc = -1;
2715  }
2716  if (dup2(xh->fStdOutDup, STDOUT_FILENO) < 0) {
2717  SysError("RedirectOutput", "could not restore stdout (back to original redirected"
2718  " file) (errno: %d)", TSystem::GetErrno());
2719  rc = -1;
2720  }
2721  if (close(xh->fStdOutDup) != 0) {
2722  SysError("RedirectOutput",
2723  "problems closing temporary 'out' descriptor %d (errno: %d)",
2724  TSystem::GetErrno(), xh->fStdOutDup);
2725  rc = -1;
2726  }
2727  }
2728  fflush(stderr);
2729  if (!(xh->fStdErrTty.IsNull())) {
2730  if (freopen(xh->fStdErrTty.Data(), "a", stderr) == 0) {
2731  SysError("RedirectOutput", "could not restore stderr (errno: %d)", TSystem::GetErrno());
2732  rc = -1;
2733  }
2734  xh->fStdErrTty = "";
2735  } else {
2736  if (close(STDERR_FILENO) != 0) {
2737  SysError("RedirectOutput",
2738  "problems closing STDERR_FILENO (%d) before 'dup2' (errno: %d)",
2739  STDERR_FILENO, TSystem::GetErrno());
2740  rc = -1;
2741  }
2742  if (dup2(xh->fStdErrDup, STDERR_FILENO) < 0) {
2743  SysError("RedirectOutput", "could not restore stderr (back to original redirected"
2744  " file) (errno: %d)", TSystem::GetErrno());
2745  rc = -1;
2746  }
2747  if (close(xh->fStdErrDup) != 0) {
2748  SysError("RedirectOutput",
2749  "problems closing temporary 'err' descriptor %d (errno: %d)",
2750  TSystem::GetErrno(), xh->fStdErrDup);
2751  rc = -1;
2752  }
2753  }
2754  // Reset the static instance, if using that
2755  if (xh == &loch)
2756  xh->Reset();
2757  }
2758  return rc;
2759 }

2805 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2806 /// Get list of shared libraries loaded at the start of the executable.
2807 /// Returns 0 in case list cannot be obtained or in case of error.
2808 
2809 const char *TUnixSystem::GetLinkedLibraries()
2810 {
2811  static TString linkedLibs;
2812  static Bool_t once = kFALSE;
2813 
2814  R__LOCKGUARD2(gSystemMutex);
2815 
2816  if (!linkedLibs.IsNull())
2817  return linkedLibs;
2818 
2819  if (once)
2820  return 0;
2821 
2822 #if !defined(R__MACOSX)
2823  const char *exe = GetExePath();
2824  if (!exe || !*exe)
2825  return 0;
2826 #endif
2827 
2828 #if defined(R__MACOSX)
2829  DylibAdded(0, 0);
2830  linkedLibs = gLinkedDylibs;
2831 #if 0
2832  FILE *p = OpenPipe(TString::Format("otool -L %s", exe), "r");
2833  TString otool;
2834  while (otool.Gets(p)) {
2835  TString delim(" \t");
2836  TObjArray *tok = otool.Tokenize(delim);
2837  TString dylib = ((TObjString*)tok->At(0))->String();
2838  if (dylib.EndsWith(".dylib") && !dylib.Contains("/libSystem.B.dylib")) {
2839  if (!linkedLibs.IsNull())
2840  linkedLibs += " ";
2841  linkedLibs += dylib;
2842  }
2843  delete tok;
2844  }
2845  if (p) {
2846  ClosePipe(p);
2847  }
2848 #endif
2849 #elif defined(R__LINUX) || defined(R__SOLARIS) || defined(R__AIX)
2850 #if defined(R__WINGCC )
2851  const char *cLDD="cygcheck";
2852  const char *cSOEXT=".dll";
2853  size_t lenexe = strlen(exe);
2854  if (strcmp(exe + lenexe - 4, ".exe")
2855  && strcmp(exe + lenexe - 4, ".dll")) {
2856  // it's not a dll and exe doesn't end on ".exe";
2857  // need to add it for cygcheck to find it:
2858  char* longerexe = new char[lenexe + 5];
2859  strlcpy(longerexe, exe,lenexe+5);
2860  strlcat(longerexe, ".exe",lenexe+5);
2861  delete [] exe;
2862  exe = longerexe;
2863  }
2864  TRegexp sovers = "\\.so\\.[0-9]+";
2865 #else
2866  const char *cLDD="ldd";
2867 #if defined(R__AIX)
2868  const char *cSOEXT=".a";
2869  TRegexp sovers = "\\.a\\.[0-9]+";
2870 #else
2871  const char *cSOEXT=".so";
2872  TRegexp sovers = "\\.so\\.[0-9]+";
2873 #endif
2874 #endif
2875  FILE *p = OpenPipe(TString::Format("%s '%s'", cLDD, exe), "r");
2876  if (p) {
2877  TString ldd;
2878  while (ldd.Gets(p)) {
2879  TString delim(" \t");
2880  TObjArray *tok = ldd.Tokenize(delim);
2881 
2882  // expected format:
2883  // libCore.so => /home/rdm/root/lib/libCore.so (0x40017000)
2884  TObjString *solibName = (TObjString*)tok->At(2);
2885  if (!solibName) {
2886  // case where there is only one name of the list:
2887  // /usr/platform/SUNW,UltraAX-i2/lib/libc_psr.so.1
2888  solibName = (TObjString*)tok->At(0);
2889  }
2890  if (solibName) {
2891  TString solib = solibName->String();
2892  Ssiz_t idx = solib.Index(sovers);
2893  if (solib.EndsWith(cSOEXT) || idx != kNPOS) {
2894  if (idx != kNPOS)
2895  solib.Remove(idx+3);
2896  if (!AccessPathName(solib, kReadPermission)) {
2897  if (!linkedLibs.IsNull())
2898  linkedLibs += " ";
2899  linkedLibs += solib;
2900  }
2901  }
2902  }
2903  delete tok;
2904  }
2905  ClosePipe(p);
2906  }
2907 #endif
2908 
2909  once = kTRUE;
2910 
2911  if (linkedLibs.IsNull())
2912  return 0;
2913 
2914  return linkedLibs;
2915 }

2927 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2928 /// Handle and dispatch timers. If mode = kTRUE dispatch synchronous
2929 /// timers else a-synchronous timers.
2930 
2931 Bool_t TUnixSystem::DispatchTimers(Bool_t mode)
2932 {
2933  if (!fTimers) return kFALSE;
2934 
2935  fInsideNotify = kTRUE;
2936 
2937  TOrdCollectionIter it((TOrdCollection*)fTimers);
2938  TTimer *t;
2939  Bool_t timedout = kFALSE;
2940 
2941  while ((t = (TTimer *) it.Next())) {
2942  // NB: the timer resolution is added in TTimer::CheckTimer()
2943  Long64_t now = UnixNow();
2944  if (mode && t->IsSync()) {
2945  if (t->CheckTimer(now))
2946  timedout = kTRUE;
2947  } else if (!mode && t->IsAsync()) {
2948  if (t->CheckTimer(now)) {
2949  UnixSetitimer(NextTimeOut(kFALSE));
2950  timedout = kTRUE;
2951  }
2952  }
2953  }
2954  fInsideNotify = kFALSE;
2955  return timedout;
2956 }

2967 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2968 /// Remove timer from list of system timers.
2969 
2970 TTimer *TUnixSystem::RemoveTimer(TTimer *ti)
2971 {
2972  if (!ti) return 0;
2973 
2974  R__LOCKGUARD2(gSystemMutex);
2975 
2976  TTimer *t = TSystem::RemoveTimer(ti);
2977  if (ti->IsAsync())
2978  UnixSetitimer(NextTimeOut(kFALSE));
2979  return t;
2980 }

2984 
2985 void TUnixSystem::ResetTimer(TTimer *ti)
2986 {
2987  if (!fInsideNotify && ti && ti->IsAsync())
2988  UnixSetitimer(NextTimeOut(kFALSE));
2989 }

2993 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2994 /// Get Internet Protocol (IP) address of host. Returns an TInetAddress
2995 /// object. To see if the hostname lookup was successfull call
2996 /// TInetAddress::IsValid().
2997 
2998 TInetAddress TUnixSystem::GetHostByName(const char *hostname)
2999 {
3000  TInetAddress ia;
3001  struct addrinfo hints;
3002  struct addrinfo *result, *rp;
3003  memset(&hints, 0, sizeof(struct addrinfo));
3004  hints.ai_family = AF_INET; // only IPv4
3005  hints.ai_socktype = 0; // any socket type
3006  hints.ai_protocol = 0; // any protocol
3007  hints.ai_flags = AI_CANONNAME; // get canonical name
3008 #ifdef R__MACOSX
3009  // Anything ending on ".local" causes a 5 second delay in getaddrinfo().
3010  // See e.g. https://apple.stackexchange.com/questions/175320/why-is-my-hostname-resolution-taking-so-long
3011  // Only reasonable solution: remove the "domain" part if it's ".local".
3012  size_t lenHostname = strlen(hostname);
3013  std::string hostnameWithoutLocal{hostname};
3014  if (lenHostname > 6 && !strcmp(hostname + lenHostname - 6, ".local")) {
3015  hostnameWithoutLocal.erase(lenHostname - 6);
3016  hostname = hostnameWithoutLocal.c_str();
3017  }
3018 #endif
3019 
3020  // obsolete gethostbyname() replaced by getaddrinfo()
3021  int rc = getaddrinfo(hostname, nullptr, &hints, &result);
3022  if (rc != 0) {
3023  if (rc == EAI_NONAME) {
3024  if (gDebug > 0) Error("GetHostByName", "unknown host '%s'", hostname);
3025  ia.fHostname = "UnNamedHost";
3026  } else {
3027  Error("GetHostByName", "getaddrinfo failed for '%s': %s", hostname, gai_strerror(rc));
3028  ia.fHostname = "UnknownHost";
3029  }
3030  return ia;
3031  }
3032 
3033  std::string hostcanon(result->ai_canonname ? result->ai_canonname : hostname);
3034  ia.fHostname = hostcanon.data();
3035  ia.fFamily = result->ai_family;
3036  ia.fAddresses[0] = ntohl(((struct sockaddr_in *)(result->ai_addr))->sin_addr.s_addr);
3037  // with getaddrinfo() no way to get list of aliases for a hostname
3038  if (hostcanon.compare(hostname) != 0) ia.AddAlias(hostname);
3039 
3040  // check on numeric hostname
3041  char tmp[sizeof(struct in_addr)];
3042  if (inet_pton(AF_INET, hostcanon.data(), tmp) == 1) {
3043  char hbuf[NI_MAXHOST];
3044  if (getnameinfo(result->ai_addr, result->ai_addrlen, hbuf, sizeof(hbuf), nullptr, 0, 0) == 0)
3045  ia.fHostname = hbuf;
3046  }
3047 
3048  // check other addresses (if exist)
3049  rp = result->ai_next;
3050  for (; rp != nullptr; rp = rp->ai_next) {
3051  UInt_t arp = ntohl(((struct sockaddr_in *)(rp->ai_addr))->sin_addr.s_addr);
3052  if ( !(std::find(ia.fAddresses.begin(), ia.fAddresses.end(), arp) != ia.fAddresses.end()) )
3053  ia.AddAddress(arp);
3054  }
3055 
3056  freeaddrinfo(result);
3057  return ia;
3058 }

3060 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3061 /// Get Internet Protocol (IP) address of host and port #.
3062 
3063 TInetAddress TUnixSystem::GetSockName(int sock)
3064 {
3065  struct sockaddr addr;
3066 #if defined(USE_SIZE_T)
3067  size_t len = sizeof(addr);
3068 #elif defined(USE_SOCKLEN_T)
3069  socklen_t len = sizeof(addr);
3070 #else
3071  int len = sizeof(addr);
3072 #endif
3073 
3074  TInetAddress ia;
3075  if (getsockname(sock, &addr, &len) == -1) {
3076  SysError("GetSockName", "getsockname failed");
3077  return ia;
3078  }
3079 
3080  if (addr.sa_family != AF_INET) return ia; // only IPv4
3081  ia.fFamily = addr.sa_family;
3082  struct sockaddr_in *addrin = (struct sockaddr_in *)&addr;
3083  ia.fPort = ntohs(addrin->sin_port);
3084  ia.fAddresses[0] = ntohl(addrin->sin_addr.s_addr);
3085 
3086  char hbuf[NI_MAXHOST];
3087  if (getnameinfo(&addr, sizeof(struct sockaddr), hbuf, sizeof(hbuf), nullptr, 0, 0) != 0) {
3088  Error("GetSockName", "getnameinfo failed");
3089  ia.fHostname = "????";
3090  } else
3091  ia.fHostname = hbuf;
3092 
3093  return ia;
3094 }

3235 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3236 /// Accept a connection. In case of an error return -1. In case
3237 /// non-blocking I/O is enabled and no connections are available
3238 /// return -2.
3239 
3240 int TUnixSystem::AcceptConnection(int sock)
3241 {
3242  int soc = -1;
3243 
3244  while ((soc = ::accept(sock, 0, 0)) == -1 && GetErrno() == EINTR)
3245  ResetErrno();
3246 
3247  if (soc == -1) {
3248  if (GetErrno() == EWOULDBLOCK)
3249  return -2;
3250  else {
3251  SysError("AcceptConnection", "accept");
3252  return -1;
3253  }
3254  }
3255 
3256  return soc;
3257 }
