3259 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3260 /// Close socket.
3261 
3262 void TUnixSystem::CloseConnection(int sock, Bool_t force)
3263 {
3264  if (sock < 0) return;
3265 
3266 #if !defined(R__AIX) || defined(_AIX41) || defined(_AIX43)
3267  if (force)
3268  ::shutdown(sock, 2); // will also close connection of parent
3269 #endif
3270 
3271  while (::close(sock) == -1 && GetErrno() == EINTR)
3272  ResetErrno();
3273 }
3274 
3275 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3276 /// Receive a buffer headed by a length indicator. Length is the size of
3277 /// the buffer. Returns the number of bytes received in buf or -1 in
3278 /// case of error.
3279 
3280 int TUnixSystem::RecvBuf(int sock, void *buf, int length)
3281 {
3282  Int_t header;
3283 
3284  if (UnixRecv(sock, &header, sizeof(header), 0) > 0) {
3285  int count = ntohl(header);
3286 
3287  if (count > length) {
3288  Error("RecvBuf", "record header exceeds buffer size");
3289  return -1;
3290  } else if (count > 0) {
3291  if (UnixRecv(sock, buf, count, 0) < 0) {
3292  Error("RecvBuf", "cannot receive buffer");
3293  return -1;
3294  }
3295  }
3296  return count;
3297  }
3298  return -1;
3299 }
3300 
3301 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3302 /// Send a buffer headed by a length indicator. Returns length of sent buffer
3303 /// or -1 in case of error.
3304 
3305 int TUnixSystem::SendBuf(int sock, const void *buf, int length)
3306 {
3307  Int_t header = htonl(length);
3308 
3309  if (UnixSend(sock, &header, sizeof(header), 0) < 0) {
3310  Error("SendBuf", "cannot send header");
3311  return -1;
3312  }
3313  if (length > 0) {
3314  if (UnixSend(sock, buf, length, 0) < 0) {
3315  Error("SendBuf", "cannot send buffer");
3316  return -1;
3317  }
3318  }
3319  return length;
3320 }
3321 
3322 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3323 /// Receive exactly length bytes into buffer. Use opt to receive out-of-band
3324 /// data or to have a peek at what is in the buffer (see TSocket). Buffer
3325 /// must be able to store at least length bytes. Returns the number of
3326 /// bytes received (can be 0 if other side of connection was closed) or -1
3327 /// in case of error, -2 in case of MSG_OOB and errno == EWOULDBLOCK, -3
3328 /// in case of MSG_OOB and errno == EINVAL and -4 in case of kNoBlock and
3329 /// errno == EWOULDBLOCK. Returns -5 if pipe broken or reset by peer
3330 /// (EPIPE || ECONNRESET).
3331 
3332 int TUnixSystem::RecvRaw(int sock, void *buf, int length, int opt)
3333 {
3334  int flag;
3335 
3336  switch (opt) {
3337  case kDefault:
3338  flag = 0;
3339  break;
3340  case kOob:
3341  flag = MSG_OOB;
3342  break;
3343  case kPeek:
3344  flag = MSG_PEEK;
3345  break;
3346  case kDontBlock:
3347  flag = -1;
3348  break;
3349  default:
3350  flag = 0;
3351  break;
3352  }
3353 
3354  int n;
3355  if ((n = UnixRecv(sock, buf, length, flag)) <= 0) {
3356  if (n == -1 && GetErrno() != EINTR)
3357  Error("RecvRaw", "cannot receive buffer");
3358  return n;
3359  }
3360  return n;
3361 }
3362 
3363 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3364 /// Send exactly length bytes from buffer. Use opt to send out-of-band
3365 /// data (see TSocket). Returns the number of bytes sent or -1 in case of
3366 /// error. Returns -4 in case of kNoBlock and errno == EWOULDBLOCK.
3367 /// Returns -5 if pipe broken or reset by peer (EPIPE || ECONNRESET).
3368 
3369 int TUnixSystem::SendRaw(int sock, const void *buf, int length, int opt)
3370 {
3371  int flag;
3372 
3373  switch (opt) {
3374  case kDefault:
3375  flag = 0;
3376  break;
3377  case kOob:
3378  flag = MSG_OOB;
3379  break;
3380  case kDontBlock:
3381  flag = -1;
3382  break;
3383  case kPeek: // receive only option (see RecvRaw)
3384  default:
3385  flag = 0;
3386  break;
3387  }
3388 
3389  int n;
3390  if ((n = UnixSend(sock, buf, length, flag)) <= 0) {
3391  if (n == -1 && GetErrno() != EINTR)
3392  Error("SendRaw", "cannot send buffer");
3393  return n;
3394  }
3395  return n;
3396 }
3397 
3398 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3399 /// Set socket option.
3400 
3401 int TUnixSystem::SetSockOpt(int sock, int opt, int val)
3402 {
3403  if (sock < 0) return -1;
3404 
3405  switch (opt) {
3406  case kSendBuffer:
3407  if (setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, (char*)&val, sizeof(val)) == -1) {
3408  SysError("SetSockOpt", "setsockopt(SO_SNDBUF)");
3409  return -1;
3410  }
3411  break;
3412  case kRecvBuffer:
3413  if (setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, (char*)&val, sizeof(val)) == -1) {
3414  SysError("SetSockOpt", "setsockopt(SO_RCVBUF)");
3415  return -1;
3416  }
3417  break;
3418  case kOobInline:
3419  if (setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_OOBINLINE, (char*)&val, sizeof(val)) == -1) {
3420  SysError("SetSockOpt", "setsockopt(SO_OOBINLINE)");
3421  return -1;
3422  }
3423  break;
3424  case kKeepAlive:
3425  if (setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_KEEPALIVE, (char*)&val, sizeof(val)) == -1) {
3426  SysError("SetSockOpt", "setsockopt(SO_KEEPALIVE)");
3427  return -1;
3428  }
3429  break;
3430  case kReuseAddr:
3431  if (setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, (char*)&val, sizeof(val)) == -1) {
3432  SysError("SetSockOpt", "setsockopt(SO_REUSEADDR)");
3433  return -1;
3434  }
3435  break;
3436  case kNoDelay:
3437  if (setsockopt(sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, (char*)&val, sizeof(val)) == -1) {
3438  SysError("SetSockOpt", "setsockopt(TCP_NODELAY)");
3439  return -1;
3440  }
3441  break;
3442  case kNoBlock:
3443  if (ioctl(sock, FIONBIO, (char*)&val) == -1) {
3444  SysError("SetSockOpt", "ioctl(FIONBIO)");
3445  return -1;
3446  }
3447  break;
3448  case kProcessGroup:
3449 #ifndef R__WINGCC
3450  if (ioctl(sock, SIOCSPGRP, (char*)&val) == -1) {
3451  SysError("SetSockOpt", "ioctl(SIOCSPGRP)");
3452  return -1;
3453  }
3454 #else
3455  Error("SetSockOpt", "ioctl(SIOCGPGRP) not supported on cygwin/gcc");
3456  return -1;
3457 #endif
3458  break;
3459  case kAtMark: // read-only option (see GetSockOpt)
3460  case kBytesToRead: // read-only option
3461  default:
3462  Error("SetSockOpt", "illegal option (%d)", opt);
3463  return -1;
3464  }
3465  return 0;
3466 }
3467 
3468 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3469 /// Get socket option.
3470 
3471 int TUnixSystem::GetSockOpt(int sock, int opt, int *val)
3472 {
3473  if (sock < 0) return -1;
3474 
3475 #if defined(USE_SOCKLEN_T) || defined(_AIX43)
3476  socklen_t optlen = sizeof(*val);
3477 #elif defined(USE_SIZE_T)
3478  size_t optlen = sizeof(*val);
3479 #else
3480  int optlen = sizeof(*val);
3481 #endif
3482 
3483  switch (opt) {
3484  case kSendBuffer:
3485  if (getsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDBUF, (char*)val, &optlen) == -1) {
3486  SysError("GetSockOpt", "getsockopt(SO_SNDBUF)");
3487  return -1;
3488  }
3489  break;
3490  case kRecvBuffer:
3491  if (getsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVBUF, (char*)val, &optlen) == -1) {
3492  SysError("GetSockOpt", "getsockopt(SO_RCVBUF)");
3493  return -1;
3494  }
3495  break;
3496  case kOobInline:
3497  if (getsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_OOBINLINE, (char*)val, &optlen) == -1) {
3498  SysError("GetSockOpt", "getsockopt(SO_OOBINLINE)");
3499  return -1;
3500  }
3501  break;
3502  case kKeepAlive:
3503  if (getsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_KEEPALIVE, (char*)val, &optlen) == -1) {
3504  SysError("GetSockOpt", "getsockopt(SO_KEEPALIVE)");
3505  return -1;
3506  }
3507  break;
3508  case kReuseAddr:
3509  if (getsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, (char*)val, &optlen) == -1) {
3510  SysError("GetSockOpt", "getsockopt(SO_REUSEADDR)");
3511  return -1;
3512  }
3513  break;
3514  case kNoDelay:
3515  if (getsockopt(sock, IPPROTO_TCP, TCP_NODELAY, (char*)val, &optlen) == -1) {
3516  SysError("GetSockOpt", "getsockopt(TCP_NODELAY)");
3517  return -1;
3518  }
3519  break;
3520  case kNoBlock:
3521  int flg;
3522  if ((flg = fcntl(sock, F_GETFL, 0)) == -1) {
3523  SysError("GetSockOpt", "fcntl(F_GETFL)");
3524  return -1;
3525  }
3526  *val = flg & O_NDELAY;
3527  break;
3528  case kProcessGroup:
3529 #if !defined(R__LYNXOS) && !defined(R__WINGCC)
3530  if (ioctl(sock, SIOCGPGRP, (char*)val) == -1) {
3531  SysError("GetSockOpt", "ioctl(SIOCGPGRP)");
3532  return -1;
3533  }
3534 #else
3535  Error("GetSockOpt", "ioctl(SIOCGPGRP) not supported on LynxOS and cygwin/gcc");
3536  return -1;
3537 #endif
3538  break;
3539  case kAtMark:
3540 #if !defined(R__LYNXOS)
3541  if (ioctl(sock, SIOCATMARK, (char*)val) == -1) {
3542  SysError("GetSockOpt", "ioctl(SIOCATMARK)");
3543  return -1;
3544  }
3545 #else
3546  Error("GetSockOpt", "ioctl(SIOCATMARK) not supported on LynxOS");
3547  return -1;
3548 #endif
3549  break;
3550  case kBytesToRead:
3551 #if !defined(R__LYNXOS)
3552  if (ioctl(sock, FIONREAD, (char*)val) == -1) {
3553  SysError("GetSockOpt", "ioctl(FIONREAD)");
3554  return -1;
3555  }
3556 #else
3557  Error("GetSockOpt", "ioctl(FIONREAD) not supported on LynxOS");
3558  return -1;
3559 #endif
3560  break;
3561  default:
3562  Error("GetSockOpt", "illegal option (%d)", opt);
3563  *val = 0;
3564  return -1;
3565  }
3566  return 0;
3567 }

3569 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3570 // //
3571 // Static Protected Unix Interface functions. //
3572 // //
3573 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3574 
3575 //---- signals -----------------------------------------------------------------
3576 
3577 static struct Signalmap_t {
3578  int fCode;
3579  SigHandler_t fHandler;
3580  struct sigaction *fOldHandler;
3581  const char *fSigName;
3582 } gSignalMap[kMAXSIGNALS] = { // the order of the signals should be identical
3583  { SIGBUS, 0, 0, "bus error" }, // to the one in TSysEvtHandler.h
3584  { SIGSEGV, 0, 0, "segmentation violation" },
3585  { SIGSYS, 0, 0, "bad argument to system call" },
3586  { SIGPIPE, 0, 0, "write on a pipe with no one to read it" },
3587  { SIGILL, 0, 0, "illegal instruction" },
3588  { SIGQUIT, 0, 0, "quit" },
3589  { SIGINT, 0, 0, "interrupt" },
3590  { SIGWINCH, 0, 0, "window size change" },
3591  { SIGALRM, 0, 0, "alarm clock" },
3592  { SIGCHLD, 0, 0, "death of a child" },
3593  { SIGURG, 0, 0, "urgent data arrived on an I/O channel" },
3594  { SIGFPE, 0, 0, "floating point exception" },
3595  { SIGTERM, 0, 0, "termination signal" },
3596  { SIGUSR1, 0, 0, "user-defined signal 1" },
3597  { SIGUSR2, 0, 0, "user-defined signal 2" }
3598 };
3599 
3600 
3601 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3602 /// Call the signal handler associated with the signal.
3603 
3604 static void sighandler(int sig)
3605 {
3606  for (int i= 0; i < kMAXSIGNALS; i++) {
3607  if (gSignalMap[i].fCode == sig) {
3608  (*gSignalMap[i].fHandler)((ESignals)i);
3609  return;
3610  }
3611  }
3612 }
3613 
3614 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3615 /// Handle and dispatch signals.
3616 
3617 void TUnixSystem::DispatchSignals(ESignals sig)
3618 {
3619  switch (sig) {
3620  case kSigAlarm:
3621  DispatchTimers(kFALSE);
3622  break;
3623  case kSigChild:
3624  CheckChilds();
3625  break;
3626  case kSigBus:
3627  case kSigSegmentationViolation:
3628  case kSigIllegalInstruction:
3629  case kSigFloatingException:
3630  Break("TUnixSystem::DispatchSignals", "%s", UnixSigname(sig));
3631  StackTrace();
3632  if (gApplication)
3633  //sig is ESignal, should it be mapped to the correct signal number?
3634  gApplication->HandleException(sig);
3635  else
3636  //map to the real signal code + set the
3637  //high order bit to indicate a signal (?)
3638  Exit(gSignalMap[sig].fCode + 0x80);
3639  break;
3640  case kSigSystem:
3641  case kSigPipe:
3642  Break("TUnixSystem::DispatchSignals", "%s", UnixSigname(sig));
3643  break;
3644  case kSigWindowChanged:
3645  Gl_windowchanged();
3646  break;
3647  case kSigUser2:
3648  Break("TUnixSystem::DispatchSignals", "%s: printing stacktrace", UnixSigname(sig));
3649  StackTrace();
3650  // Intentional fall-through; pass the signal to handlers (or terminate):
3651  default:
3652  fSignals->Set(sig);
3653  fSigcnt++;
3654  break;
3655  }
3656 
3657  // check a-synchronous signals
3658  if (fSigcnt > 0 && fSignalHandler->GetSize() > 0)
3659  CheckSignals(kFALSE);
3660 }
3661 
3662 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3663 /// Set a signal handler for a signal.
3664 
3665 void TUnixSystem::UnixSignal(ESignals sig, SigHandler_t handler)
3666 {
3667  if (gEnv && !gEnv->GetValue("Root.ErrorHandlers", 1))
3668  return;
3669 
3670  if (gSignalMap[sig].fHandler != handler) {
3671  struct sigaction sigact;
3672 
3673  gSignalMap[sig].fHandler = handler;
3674  gSignalMap[sig].fOldHandler = new struct sigaction();
3675 
3676 #if defined(R__SUN)
3677  sigact.sa_handler = (void (*)())sighandler;
3678 #elif defined(R__SOLARIS)
3679  sigact.sa_handler = sighandler;
3680 #elif defined(R__LYNXOS)
3681 # if (__GNUG__>=3)
3682  sigact.sa_handler = sighandler;
3683 # else
3684  sigact.sa_handler = (void (*)(...))sighandler;
3685 # endif
3686 #else
3687  sigact.sa_handler = sighandler;
3688 #endif
3689  sigemptyset(&sigact.sa_mask);
3690  sigact.sa_flags = 0;
3691 #if defined(SA_RESTART)
3692  sigact.sa_flags |= SA_RESTART;
3693 #endif
3694  if (sigaction(gSignalMap[sig].fCode, &sigact,
3695  gSignalMap[sig].fOldHandler) < 0)
3696  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixSignal", "sigaction");
3697  }
3698 }
3699 
3700 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3701 /// If ignore is true ignore the specified signal, else restore previous
3702 /// behaviour.
3703 
3704 void TUnixSystem::UnixIgnoreSignal(ESignals sig, Bool_t ignore)
3705 {
3706  TTHREAD_TLS(Bool_t) ignoreSig[kMAXSIGNALS] = { kFALSE };
3707  TTHREAD_TLS_ARRAY(struct sigaction,kMAXSIGNALS,oldsigact);
3708 
3709  if (ignore != ignoreSig[sig]) {
3710  ignoreSig[sig] = ignore;
3711  if (ignore) {
3712  struct sigaction sigact;
3713 #if defined(R__SUN)
3714  sigact.sa_handler = (void (*)())SIG_IGN;
3715 #elif defined(R__SOLARIS)
3716  sigact.sa_handler = (void (*)(int))SIG_IGN;
3717 #else
3718  sigact.sa_handler = SIG_IGN;
3719 #endif
3720  sigemptyset(&sigact.sa_mask);
3721  sigact.sa_flags = 0;
3722  if (sigaction(gSignalMap[sig].fCode, &sigact, &oldsigact[sig]) < 0)
3723  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixIgnoreSignal", "sigaction");
3724  } else {
3725  if (sigaction(gSignalMap[sig].fCode, &oldsigact[sig], 0) < 0)
3726  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixIgnoreSignal", "sigaction");
3727  }
3728  }
3729 }
3730 
3731 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3732 /// When the argument is true the SIGALRM signal handler is set so that
3733 /// interrupted syscalls will not be restarted by the kernel. This is
3734 /// typically used in case one wants to put a timeout on an I/O operation.
3735 /// By default interrupted syscalls will always be restarted (for all
3736 /// signals). This can be controlled for each a-synchronous TTimer via
3737 /// the method TTimer::SetInterruptSyscalls().
3738 
3739 void TUnixSystem::UnixSigAlarmInterruptsSyscalls(Bool_t set)
3740 {
3741  if (gSignalMap[kSigAlarm].fHandler) {
3742  struct sigaction sigact;
3743 #if defined(R__SUN)
3744  sigact.sa_handler = (void (*)())sighandler;
3745 #elif defined(R__SOLARIS)
3746  sigact.sa_handler = sighandler;
3747 #elif defined(R__LYNXOS)
3748 # if (__GNUG__>=3)
3749  sigact.sa_handler = sighandler;
3750 # else
3751  sigact.sa_handler = (void (*)(...))sighandler;
3752 # endif
3753 #else
3754  sigact.sa_handler = sighandler;
3755 #endif
3756  sigemptyset(&sigact.sa_mask);
3757  sigact.sa_flags = 0;
3758  if (set) {
3759 #if defined(SA_INTERRUPT) // SunOS
3760  sigact.sa_flags |= SA_INTERRUPT;
3761 #endif
3762  } else {
3763 #if defined(SA_RESTART)
3764  sigact.sa_flags |= SA_RESTART;
3765 #endif
3766  }
3767  if (sigaction(gSignalMap[kSigAlarm].fCode, &sigact, 0) < 0)
3768  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixSigAlarmInterruptsSyscalls", "sigaction");
3769  }
3770 }
3771 
3772 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3773 /// Return the signal name associated with a signal.
3774 
3775 const char *TUnixSystem::UnixSigname(ESignals sig)
3776 {
3777  return gSignalMap[sig].fSigName;
3778 }
3779 
3780 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3781 /// Restore old signal handler for specified signal.
3782 
3783 void TUnixSystem::UnixResetSignal(ESignals sig)
3784 {
3785  if (gSignalMap[sig].fOldHandler) {
3786  // restore old signal handler
3787  if (sigaction(gSignalMap[sig].fCode, gSignalMap[sig].fOldHandler, 0) < 0)
3788  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixSignal", "sigaction");
3789  delete gSignalMap[sig].fOldHandler;
3790  gSignalMap[sig].fOldHandler = 0;
3791  gSignalMap[sig].fHandler = 0;
3792  }
3793 }
3794 
3795 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3796 /// Restore old signal handlers.
3797 
3798 void TUnixSystem::UnixResetSignals()
3799 {
3800  for (int sig = 0; sig < kMAXSIGNALS; sig++)
3801  UnixResetSignal((ESignals)sig);
3802 }

3804 //---- time --------------------------------------------------------------------
3805 
3806 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3807 /// Get current time in milliseconds since 0:00 Jan 1 1995.
3808 
3809 Long64_t TUnixSystem::UnixNow()
3810 {
3811  static std::atomic<time_t> jan95{0};
3812  if (!jan95) {
3813  struct tm tp;
3814  tp.tm_year = 95;
3815  tp.tm_mon = 0;
3816  tp.tm_mday = 1;
3817  tp.tm_hour = 0;
3818  tp.tm_min = 0;
3819  tp.tm_sec = 0;
3820  tp.tm_isdst = -1;
3821 
3822  jan95 = mktime(&tp);
3823  if ((int)jan95 == -1) {
3824  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixNow", "error converting 950001 0:00 to time_t");
3825  return 0;
3826  }
3827  }
3828 
3829  struct timeval t;
3830  gettimeofday(&t, 0);
3831  return Long64_t(t.tv_sec-(Long_t)jan95)*1000 + t.tv_usec/1000;
3832 }
3833 
3834 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3835 /// Set interval timer to time-out in ms milliseconds.
3836 
3837 int TUnixSystem::UnixSetitimer(Long_t ms)
3838 {
3839  struct itimerval itv;
3840  itv.it_value.tv_sec = 0;
3841  itv.it_value.tv_usec = 0;
3842  itv.it_interval.tv_sec = 0;
3843  itv.it_interval.tv_usec = 0;
3844  if (ms > 0) {
3845  itv.it_value.tv_sec = time_t(ms / 1000);
3846  itv.it_value.tv_usec = time_t((ms % 1000) * 1000);
3847  }
3848  int st = setitimer(ITIMER_REAL, &itv, 0);
3849  if (st == -1)
3850  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixSetitimer", "setitimer");
3851  return st;
3852 }
3853 
3854 //---- file descriptors --------------------------------------------------------
3855 
3856 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3857 /// Wait for events on the file descriptors specified in the readready and
3858 /// writeready masks or for timeout (in milliseconds) to occur. Returns
3859 /// the number of ready descriptors, or 0 in case of timeout, or < 0 in
3860 /// case of an error, with -2 being EINTR and -3 EBADF. In case of EINTR
3861 /// the errno has been reset and the method can be called again.
3862 
3863 int TUnixSystem::UnixSelect(Int_t nfds, TFdSet *readready, TFdSet *writeready,
3864  Long_t timeout)
3865 {
3866  int retcode;
3867 
3868  fd_set *rd = (readready) ? (fd_set*)readready->GetBits() : 0;
3869  fd_set *wr = (writeready) ? (fd_set*)writeready->GetBits() : 0;
3870 
3871  if (timeout >= 0) {
3872  struct timeval tv;
3873  tv.tv_sec = Int_t(timeout / 1000);
3874  tv.tv_usec = (timeout % 1000) * 1000;
3875  retcode = select(nfds, rd, wr, 0, &tv);
3876  } else {
3877  retcode = select(nfds, rd, wr, 0, 0);
3878  }
3879  if (retcode == -1) {
3880  if (GetErrno() == EINTR) {
3881  ResetErrno(); // errno is not self reseting
3882  return -2;
3883  }
3884  if (GetErrno() == EBADF)
3885  return -3;
3886  return -1;
3887  }
3888 
3889  return retcode;
3890 }

3895 /// Returns the user's home directory.

3897 const char *TUnixSystem::UnixHomedirectory(const char *name)

3899  static char path[kMAXPATHLEN], mydir[kMAXPATHLEN] = { '\0' };
3900  return UnixHomedirectory(name, path, mydir);
3901 }

3903 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3904 /// Returns the user's home directory.
3905 
3906 const char *TUnixSystem::UnixHomedirectory(const char *name, char *path, char *mydir)
3907 {
3908  struct passwd *pw;
3909  if (name) {
3910  pw = getpwnam(name);
3911  if (pw) {
3912  strncpy(path, pw->pw_dir, kMAXPATHLEN-1);
3913  path[kMAXPATHLEN-1] = '\0';
3914  return path;
3915  }
3916  } else {
3917  if (mydir[0])
3918  return mydir;
3919  pw = getpwuid(getuid());
3920  if (pw && pw->pw_dir) {
3921  strncpy(mydir, pw->pw_dir, kMAXPATHLEN-1);
3922  mydir[kMAXPATHLEN-1] = '\0';
3923  return mydir;
3924  } else if (gSystem->Getenv("HOME")) {
3925  strncpy(mydir, gSystem->Getenv("HOME"), kMAXPATHLEN-1);
3926  mydir[kMAXPATHLEN-1] = '\0';
3927  return mydir;
3928  }
3929  }
3930  return 0;
3931 }

3943 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

3947 {

3951

3953  return 0;
3954

3956  return 0;

3969 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

3971

3977 #else

3979 #endif
3980

3985  return 0;

3988  }

3990  return 0;
3991 }

3995 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3996 /// Get info about a file. Info is returned in the form of a FileStat_t
3997 /// structure (see TSystem.h).
3998 /// The function returns 0 in case of success and 1 if the file could
3999 /// not be stat'ed.
4000 
4001 int TUnixSystem::UnixFilestat(const char *fpath, FileStat_t &buf)
4002 {
4003  const char *path = StripOffProto(fpath, "file:");
4004  buf.fIsLink = kFALSE;
4005 
4006 #if defined(R__SEEK64)
4007  struct stat64 sbuf;
4008  if (path && lstat64(path, &sbuf) == 0) {
4009 #else
4010  struct stat sbuf;
4011  if (path && lstat(path, &sbuf) == 0) {
4012 #endif
4013  buf.fIsLink = S_ISLNK(sbuf.st_mode);
4014  if (buf.fIsLink) {
4015 #if defined(R__SEEK64)
4016  if (stat64(path, &sbuf) == -1) {
4017 #else
4018  if (stat(path, &sbuf) == -1) {
4019 #endif
4020  return 1;
4021  }
4022  }
4023  buf.fDev = sbuf.st_dev;
4024  buf.fIno = sbuf.st_ino;
4025  buf.fMode = sbuf.st_mode;
4026  buf.fUid = sbuf.st_uid;
4027  buf.fGid = sbuf.st_gid;
4028  buf.fSize = sbuf.st_size;
4029  buf.fMtime = sbuf.st_mtime;
4030 
4031  return 0;
4032  }
4033  return 1;
4034 }
4035 
4036 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4037 /// Get info about a file system: id, bsize, bfree, blocks.
4038 /// Id is file system type (machine dependend, see statfs())
4039 /// Bsize is block size of file system
4040 /// Blocks is total number of blocks in file system
4041 /// Bfree is number of free blocks in file system
4042 /// The function returns 0 in case of success and 1 if the file system could
4043 /// not be stat'ed.
4044 
4045 int TUnixSystem::UnixFSstat(const char *path, Long_t *id, Long_t *bsize,
4046  Long_t *blocks, Long_t *bfree)
4047 {
4048  struct statfs statfsbuf;
4049 #if (defined(R__SOLARIS) && !defined(R__LINUX))
4050  if (statfs(path, &statfsbuf, sizeof(struct statfs), 0) == 0) {
4051  *id = statfsbuf.f_fstyp;
4052  *bsize = statfsbuf.f_bsize;
4053  *blocks = statfsbuf.f_blocks;
4054  *bfree = statfsbuf.f_bfree;
4055 #else
4056  if (statfs((char*)path, &statfsbuf) == 0) {
4057 #ifdef R__OBSD
4058  // Convert BSD filesystem names to Linux filesystem type numbers
4059  // where possible. Linux statfs uses a value of -1 to indicate
4060  // an unsupported field.
4061 
4062  if (!strcmp(statfsbuf.f_fstypename, MOUNT_FFS) ||
4063  !strcmp(statfsbuf.f_fstypename, MOUNT_MFS))
4064  *id = 0x11954;
4065  else if (!strcmp(statfsbuf.f_fstypename, MOUNT_NFS))
4066  *id = 0x6969;
4067  else if (!strcmp(statfsbuf.f_fstypename, MOUNT_MSDOS))
4068  *id = 0x4d44;
4069  else if (!strcmp(statfsbuf.f_fstypename, MOUNT_EXT2FS))
4070  *id = 0xef53;
4071  else if (!strcmp(statfsbuf.f_fstypename, MOUNT_CD9660))
4072  *id = 0x9660;
4073  else if (!strcmp(statfsbuf.f_fstypename, MOUNT_NCPFS))
4074  *id = 0x6969;
4075  else
4076  *id = -1;
4077 #else
4078  *id = statfsbuf.f_type;
4079 #endif
4080  *bsize = statfsbuf.f_bsize;
4081  *blocks = statfsbuf.f_blocks;
4082  *bfree = statfsbuf.f_bavail;
4083 #endif
4084  return 0;
4085  }
4086  return 1;
4087 }

4100 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4101 /// Open a TCP/IP connection to server and connect to a service (i.e. port).
4102 /// Use tcpwindowsize to specify the size of the receive buffer, it has
4103 /// to be specified here to make sure the window scale option is set (for
4104 /// tcpwindowsize > 65KB and for platforms supporting window scaling).
4105 /// Is called via the TSocket constructor. Returns -1 in case of error.
4106 
4107 int TUnixSystem::UnixTcpConnect(const char *hostname, int port,
4108  int tcpwindowsize)
4109 {
4110  short sport;
4111  struct servent *sp;
4112 
4113  if ((sp = getservbyport(htons(port), kProtocolName)))
4114  sport = sp->s_port;
4115  else
4116  sport = htons(port);
4117 
4118  TInetAddress addr = gSystem->GetHostByName(hostname);
4119  if (!addr.IsValid()) return -1;
4120  UInt_t adr = htonl(addr.GetAddress());
4121 
4122  struct sockaddr_in server;
4123  memset(&server, 0, sizeof(server));
4124  memcpy(&server.sin_addr, &adr, sizeof(adr));
4125  server.sin_family = addr.GetFamily();
4126  server.sin_port = sport;
4127 
4128  // Create socket
4129  int sock;
4130  if ((sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) < 0) {
4131  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixTcpConnect", "socket (%s:%d)",
4132  hostname, port);
4133  return -1;
4134  }
4135 
4136  if (tcpwindowsize > 0) {
4137  gSystem->SetSockOpt(sock, kRecvBuffer, tcpwindowsize);
4138  gSystem->SetSockOpt(sock, kSendBuffer, tcpwindowsize);
4139  }
4140 
4141  while (connect(sock, (struct sockaddr*) &server, sizeof(server)) == -1) {
4142  if (GetErrno() == EINTR)
4143  ResetErrno();
4144  else {
4145  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixTcpConnect", "connect (%s:%d)",
4146  hostname, port);
4147  close(sock);
4148  return -1;
4149  }
4150  }
4151  return sock;
4152 }
4153

4168 
4169  TInetAddress addr = gSystem->GetHostByName(hostname);

4173  struct sockaddr_in server;

4175  memcpy(&server.sin_addr, &adr, sizeof(adr));
4176  server.sin_family = addr.GetFamily();
4177  server.sin_port = sport;

4179  // Create socket

4208 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4209 /// Connect to a Unix domain socket. Returns -1 in case of error.
4210 
4211 int TUnixSystem::UnixUnixConnect(const char *sockpath)
4212 {
4213  if (!sockpath || strlen(sockpath) <= 0) {
4214  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixUnixConnect", "socket path undefined");
4215  return -1;
4216  }
4217 
4218  int sock;
4219  struct sockaddr_un unserver;
4220  unserver.sun_family = AF_UNIX;
4221 
4222  if (strlen(sockpath) > sizeof(unserver.sun_path)-1) {
4223  ::Error("TUnixSystem::UnixUnixConnect", "socket path %s, longer than max allowed length (%u)",
4224  sockpath, (UInt_t)sizeof(unserver.sun_path)-1);
4225  return -1;
4226  }
4227  strcpy(unserver.sun_path, sockpath);
4228 
4229  // Open socket
4230  if ((sock = socket(AF_UNIX, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) < 0) {
4231  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixUnixConnect", "socket");
4232  return -1;
4233  }
4234 
4235  while (connect(sock, (struct sockaddr*) &unserver, strlen(unserver.sun_path)+2) == -1) {
4236  if (GetErrno() == EINTR)
4237  ResetErrno();
4238  else {
4239  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixUnixConnect", "connect");
4240  close(sock);
4241  return -1;
4242  }
4243  }
4244  return sock;
4245 }
4246 
4247 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4248 /// Open a socket, bind to it and start listening for TCP/IP connections
4249 /// on the port. If reuse is true reuse the address, backlog specifies
4250 /// how many sockets can be waiting to be accepted. If port is 0 a port
4251 /// scan will be done to find a free port. This option is mutual exlusive
4252 /// with the reuse option.
4253 /// Use tcpwindowsize to specify the size of the receive buffer, it has
4254 /// to be specified here to make sure the window scale option is set (for
4255 /// tcpwindowsize > 65KB and for platforms supporting window scaling).
4256 /// Returns socket fd or -1 if socket() failed, -2 if bind() failed
4257 /// or -3 if listen() failed.
4258 
4259 int TUnixSystem::UnixTcpService(int port, Bool_t reuse, int backlog,
4260  int tcpwindowsize)
4261 {
4262  const short kSOCKET_MINPORT = 5000, kSOCKET_MAXPORT = 15000;
4263  short sport, tryport = kSOCKET_MINPORT;
4264  struct servent *sp;
4265 
4266  if (port == 0 && reuse) {
4267  ::Error("TUnixSystem::UnixTcpService", "cannot do a port scan while reuse is true");
4268  return -1;
4269  }
4270 
4271  if ((sp = getservbyport(htons(port), kProtocolName)))
4272  sport = sp->s_port;
4273  else
4274  sport = htons(port);
4275 
4276  // Create tcp socket
4277  int sock;
4278  if ((sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) < 0) {
4279  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixTcpService", "socket");
4280  return -1;
4281  }
4282 
4283  if (reuse)
4284  gSystem->SetSockOpt(sock, kReuseAddr, 1);
4285 
4286  if (tcpwindowsize > 0) {
4287  gSystem->SetSockOpt(sock, kRecvBuffer, tcpwindowsize);
4288  gSystem->SetSockOpt(sock, kSendBuffer, tcpwindowsize);
4289  }
4290 
4291  struct sockaddr_in inserver;
4292  memset(&inserver, 0, sizeof(inserver));
4293  inserver.sin_family = AF_INET;
4294  inserver.sin_addr.s_addr = htonl(INADDR_ANY);
4295  inserver.sin_port = sport;
4296 
4297  // Bind socket
4298  if (port > 0) {
4299  if (::bind(sock, (struct sockaddr*) &inserver, sizeof(inserver))) {
4300  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixTcpService", "bind");
4301  close(sock);
4302  return -2;
4303  }
4304  } else {
4305  int bret;
4306  do {
4307  inserver.sin_port = htons(tryport);
4308  bret = ::bind(sock, (struct sockaddr*) &inserver, sizeof(inserver));
4309  tryport++;
4310  } while (bret < 0 && GetErrno() == EADDRINUSE && tryport < kSOCKET_MAXPORT);
4311  if (bret < 0) {
4312  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixTcpService", "bind (port scan)");
4313  close(sock);
4314  return -2;
4315  }
4316  }
4317 
4318  // Start accepting connections
4319  if (::listen(sock, backlog)) {
4320  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixTcpService", "listen");
4321  close(sock);
4322  return -3;
4323  }
4324 
4325  return sock;
4326 }
4327

4329 /// Open a socket, bind to it and start listening for UDP connections
4330 /// on the port. If reuse is true reuse the address, backlog specifies
4331 /// how many sockets can be waiting to be accepted. If port is 0 a port
4332 /// scan will be done to find a free port. This option is mutual exlusive
4333 /// with the reuse option.
4334 
4335 int TUnixSystem::UnixUdpService(int port, int backlog)

4349  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixUdpService", "socket");
4350  return -1;
4351  }
4352

4354  memset(&inserver, 0, sizeof(inserver));

4390 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4391 /// Open a socket, bind to it and start listening for Unix domain connections
4392 /// to it. Returns socket fd or -1.
4393 
4394 int TUnixSystem::UnixUnixService(int port, int backlog)
4395 {
4396  int oldumask;
4397 
4398  // Assure that socket directory exists
4399  oldumask = umask(0);
4400  int res = ::mkdir(kServerPath, 0777);
4401  umask(oldumask);
4402 
4403  if (res == -1)
4404  return -1;
4405 
4406  // Socket path
4407  TString sockpath;
4408  sockpath.Form("%s/%d", kServerPath, port);
4409 
4410  // Remove old socket
4411  unlink(sockpath.Data());
4412 
4413  return UnixUnixService(sockpath, backlog);
4414 }

4416 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

4436  sockpath, (UInt_t)sizeof(unserver.sun_path)-1);
4437  return -1;
4438  }
4439  strcpy(unserver.sun_path, sockpath);
4440

4448  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixUnixService", "bind");
4449  close(sock);
4450  return -1;
4451  }
4452

4462 
4463 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4464 /// Receive exactly length bytes into buffer. Returns number of bytes
4465 /// received. Returns -1 in case of error, -2 in case of MSG_OOB
4466 /// and errno == EWOULDBLOCK, -3 in case of MSG_OOB and errno == EINVAL
4467 /// and -4 in case of kNoBlock and errno == EWOULDBLOCK.
4468 /// Returns -5 if pipe broken or reset by peer (EPIPE || ECONNRESET).
4469 
4470 int TUnixSystem::UnixRecv(int sock, void *buffer, int length, int flag)
4471 {
4472  ResetErrno();
4473 
4474  if (sock < 0) return -1;
4475 
4476  int once = 0;
4477  if (flag == -1) {
4478  flag = 0;
4479  once = 1;
4480  }
4481  if (flag == MSG_PEEK)
4482  once = 1;
4483 
4484  int n, nrecv = 0;
4485  char *buf = (char *)buffer;
4486 
4487  for (n = 0; n < length; n += nrecv) {
4488  if ((nrecv = recv(sock, buf+n, length-n, flag)) <= 0) {
4489  if (nrecv == 0)
4490  break; // EOF
4491  if (flag == MSG_OOB) {
4492  if (GetErrno() == EWOULDBLOCK)
4493  return -2;
4494  else if (GetErrno() == EINVAL)
4495  return -3;
4496  }
4497  if (GetErrno() == EWOULDBLOCK)
4498  return -4;
4499  else {
4500  if (GetErrno() != EINTR)
4501  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixRecv", "recv");
4502  if (GetErrno() == EPIPE || GetErrno() == ECONNRESET)
4503  return -5;
4504  else
4505  return -1;
4506  }
4507  }
4508  if (once)
4509  return nrecv;
4510  }
4511  return n;
4512 }
4513 
4514 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4515 /// Send exactly length bytes from buffer. Returns -1 in case of error,
4516 /// otherwise number of sent bytes. Returns -4 in case of kNoBlock and
4517 /// errno == EWOULDBLOCK. Returns -5 if pipe broken or reset by peer
4518 /// (EPIPE || ECONNRESET).
4519 
4520 int TUnixSystem::UnixSend(int sock, const void *buffer, int length, int flag)
4521 {
4522  if (sock < 0) return -1;
4523 
4524  int once = 0;
4525  if (flag == -1) {
4526  flag = 0;
4527  once = 1;
4528  }
4529 
4530  int n, nsent = 0;
4531  const char *buf = (const char *)buffer;
4532 
4533  for (n = 0; n < length; n += nsent) {
4534  if ((nsent = send(sock, buf+n, length-n, flag)) <= 0) {
4535  if (nsent == 0)
4536  break;
4537  if (GetErrno() == EWOULDBLOCK)
4538  return -4;
4539  else {
4540  if (GetErrno() != EINTR)
4541  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::UnixSend", "send");
4542  if (GetErrno() == EPIPE || GetErrno() == ECONNRESET)
4543  return -5;
4544  else
4545  return -1;
4546  }
4547  }
4548  if (once)
4549  return nsent;
4550  }
4551  return n;
4552 }
4553 
4554 //---- Dynamic Loading ---------------------------------------------------------
4555 
4556 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4557 /// Get shared library search path. Static utility function.
4558 
4559 static const char *DynamicPath(const char *newpath = 0, Bool_t reset = kFALSE)
4560 {
4561  static TString dynpath;
4562  static Bool_t initialized = kFALSE;
4563  if (!initialized) {
4564  // force one time initialization of gROOT before we start
4565  // (otherwise it might be done as a side effect of gEnv->GetValue and
4566  // TROOT's initialization will call this routine).
4567  gROOT;
4568  }
4569 
4570  if (newpath) {
4571  dynpath = newpath;
4572  } else if (reset || !initialized) {
4573  initialized = kTRUE;
4574  TString rdynpath = gEnv->GetValue("Root.DynamicPath", (char*)0);
4575  rdynpath.ReplaceAll(": ", ":"); // in case DynamicPath was extended
4576  if (rdynpath.IsNull()) {
4577  rdynpath = ".:"; rdynpath += TROOT::GetLibDir();
4578  }
4579  TString ldpath;
4580 #if defined (R__AIX)
4581  ldpath = gSystem->Getenv("LIBPATH");
4582 #elif defined(R__MACOSX)
4583  ldpath = gSystem->Getenv("DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH");
4584  if (!ldpath.IsNull())
4585  ldpath += ":";
4586  ldpath += gSystem->Getenv("LD_LIBRARY_PATH");
4587  if (!ldpath.IsNull())
4588  ldpath += ":";
4589  ldpath += gSystem->Getenv("DYLD_FALLBACK_LIBRARY_PATH");
4590 #else
4591  ldpath = gSystem->Getenv("LD_LIBRARY_PATH");
4592 #endif
4593  if (ldpath.IsNull())
4594  dynpath = rdynpath;
4595  else {
4596  dynpath = ldpath; dynpath += ":"; dynpath += rdynpath;
4597  }
4598  if (!dynpath.Contains(TROOT::GetLibDir())) {
4599  dynpath += ":"; dynpath += TROOT::GetLibDir();
4600  }
4601  if (gCling) {
4602  dynpath += ":"; dynpath += gCling->GetSTLIncludePath();
4603  } else
4604  initialized = kFALSE;
4605 
4606 #if defined(R__WINGCC) || defined(R__MACOSX)
4607  if (!dynpath.EndsWith(":")) dynpath += ":";
4608  dynpath += "/usr/local/lib:/usr/X11R6/lib:/usr/lib:/lib:";
4609  dynpath += "/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu:/usr/local/lib64:/usr/lib64:/lib64:";
4610 #else
4611  // trick to get the system search path
4612  std::string cmd("LD_DEBUG=libs LD_PRELOAD=DOESNOTEXIST ls 2>&1");
4613  FILE *pf = popen(cmd.c_str (), "r");
4614  std::string result = "";
4615  char buffer[128];
4616  while (!feof(pf)) {
4617  if (fgets(buffer, 128, pf) != NULL)
4618  result += buffer;
4619  }
4620  pclose(pf);
4621  std::size_t from = result.find("search path=", result.find("(LD_LIBRARY_PATH)"));
4622  std::size_t to = result.find("(system search path)");
4623  if (from != std::string::npos && to != std::string::npos) {
4624  from += 12;
4625  std::string sys_path = result.substr(from, to-from);
4626  sys_path.erase(std::remove_if(sys_path.begin(), sys_path.end(), isspace), sys_path.end());
4627  if (!dynpath.EndsWith(":")) dynpath += ":";
4628  dynpath += sys_path.c_str();
4629  }
4630  dynpath.ReplaceAll("::", ":");
4631 #endif
4632  if (gDebug > 0) std::cout << "dynpath = " << dynpath.Data() << std::endl;
4633  }
4634  return dynpath;
4635 }

4640 void TUnixSystem::AddDynamicPath(const char *path)
4641 {
4642  if (path) {
4643  TString oldpath = DynamicPath(0, kFALSE);
4644  oldpath.Append(":");
4645  oldpath.Append(path);
4646  DynamicPath(oldpath);
4647  }
4648 }

4653 const char *TUnixSystem::GetDynamicPath()
4654 {

4656 }

4658 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4659 /// Set the dynamic path to a new value.
4660 /// If the value of 'path' is zero, the dynamic path is reset to its
4661 /// default value.
4662 
4663 void TUnixSystem::SetDynamicPath(const char *path)
4664 {
4665  if (!path)
4666  DynamicPath(0, kTRUE);
4667  else

4670 
4671 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4672 /// Returns the path of a shared library (searches for library in the
4673 /// shared library search path). If no file name extension is provided
4674 /// it first tries .so, .sl, .dl and then .a (for AIX).
4675 
4676 const char *TUnixSystem::FindDynamicLibrary(TString& sLib, Bool_t quiet)
4677 {
4678  char buf[PATH_MAX + 1];
4679  char *res = realpath(sLib.Data(), buf);
4680  if (res) sLib = buf;
4681  TString searchFor = sLib;
4682  if (gSystem->FindFile(GetDynamicPath(), sLib, kReadPermission)) {
4683  return sLib;
4684  }
4685  sLib = searchFor;
4686  const char* lib = sLib.Data();
4687  int len = sLib.Length();
4688  if (len > 3 && (!strcmp(lib+len-3, ".so") ||
4689  !strcmp(lib+len-3, ".dl") ||
4690  !strcmp(lib+len-4, ".dll") ||
4691  !strcmp(lib+len-4, ".DLL") ||
4692  !strcmp(lib+len-6, ".dylib") ||
4693  !strcmp(lib+len-3, ".sl") ||
4694  !strcmp(lib+len-2, ".a"))) {
4695  if (gSystem->FindFile(GetDynamicPath(), sLib, kReadPermission)) {
4696  return sLib;
4697  }
4698  if (!quiet)
4699  Error("FindDynamicLibrary",
4700  "%s does not exist in %s", searchFor.Data(), GetDynamicPath());
4701  return 0;
4702  }
4703  static const char* exts[] = {
4704  ".so", ".dll", ".dylib", ".sl", ".dl", ".a", 0 };
4705  const char** ext = exts;
4706  while (*ext) {
4707  TString fname(sLib);
4708  fname += *ext;
4709  ++ext;
4710  if (gSystem->FindFile(GetDynamicPath(), fname, kReadPermission)) {
4711  sLib.Swap(fname);
4712  return sLib;
4713  }
4714  }
4715 
4716  if (!quiet)
4717  Error("FindDynamicLibrary",
4718  "%s[.so | .dll | .dylib | .sl | .dl | .a] does not exist in %s",
4719  searchFor.Data(), GetDynamicPath());
4720 
4721  return 0;
4722 }

4724 //---- System, CPU and Memory info ---------------------------------------------
4725 
4726 #if defined(R__MACOSX)
4727 #include <sys/resource.h>
4728 #include <mach/mach.h>

4731 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4732 /// Get system info for Mac OS X.
4733 
4734 static void GetDarwinSysInfo(SysInfo_t *sysinfo)
4735 {
4736  FILE *p = gSystem->OpenPipe("sysctl -n kern.ostype hw.model hw.ncpu hw.cpufrequency "
4737  "hw.busfrequency hw.l2cachesize hw.memsize", "r");
4738  TString s;
4739  s.Gets(p);
4740  sysinfo->fOS = s;
4741  s.Gets(p);
4742  sysinfo->fModel = s;
4743  s.Gets(p);
4744  sysinfo->fCpus = s.Atoi();
4745  s.Gets(p);
4746  Long64_t t = s.Atoll();
4747  sysinfo->fCpuSpeed = Int_t(t / 1000000);
4748  s.Gets(p);
4749  t = s.Atoll();
4750  sysinfo->fBusSpeed = Int_t(t / 1000000);
4751  s.Gets(p);
4752  sysinfo->fL2Cache = s.Atoi() / 1024;
4753  s.Gets(p);
4754  t = s.Atoll();
4755  sysinfo->fPhysRam = Int_t(t / 1024 / 1024);
4756  gSystem->ClosePipe(p);
4757  p = gSystem->OpenPipe("hostinfo", "r");
4758  while (s.Gets(p)) {
4759  if (s.BeginsWith("Processor type: ")) {
4760  TPRegexp("Processor type: ([^ ]+).*").Substitute(s, "$1");
4761  sysinfo->fCpuType = s;
4762  }
4763  }
4764  gSystem->ClosePipe(p);
4765 }
4766 
4767 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4768 /// Get CPU load on Mac OS X.
4769 
4770 static void ReadDarwinCpu(long *ticks)
4771 {
4772  mach_msg_type_number_t count;
4773  kern_return_t kr;
4774  host_cpu_load_info_data_t cpu;
4775 
4776  ticks[0] = ticks[1] = ticks[2] = ticks[3] = 0;
4777 
4778  count = HOST_CPU_LOAD_INFO_COUNT;
4779  kr = host_statistics(mach_host_self(), HOST_CPU_LOAD_INFO, (host_info_t)&cpu, &count);
4780  if (kr != KERN_SUCCESS) {
4781  ::Error("TUnixSystem::ReadDarwinCpu", "host_statistics: %s", mach_error_string(kr));
4782  } else {
4783  ticks[0] = cpu.cpu_ticks[CPU_STATE_USER];
4784  ticks[1] = cpu.cpu_ticks[CPU_STATE_SYSTEM];
4785  ticks[2] = cpu.cpu_ticks[CPU_STATE_IDLE];
4786  ticks[3] = cpu.cpu_ticks[CPU_STATE_NICE];
4787  }
4788 }
4789 
4790 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4791 /// Get CPU stat for Mac OS X. Use sampleTime to set the interval over which
4792 /// the CPU load will be measured, in ms (default 1000).
4793 
4794 static void GetDarwinCpuInfo(CpuInfo_t *cpuinfo, Int_t sampleTime)
4795 {
4796  Double_t avg[3];
4797  if (getloadavg(avg, sizeof(avg)) < 0) {
4798  ::Error("TUnixSystem::GetDarwinCpuInfo", "getloadavg failed");
4799  } else {
4800  cpuinfo->fLoad1m = (Float_t)avg[0];
4801  cpuinfo->fLoad5m = (Float_t)avg[1];
4802  cpuinfo->fLoad15m = (Float_t)avg[2];
4803  }
4804 
4805  Long_t cpu_ticks1[4], cpu_ticks2[4];
4806  ReadDarwinCpu(cpu_ticks1);
4807  gSystem->Sleep(sampleTime);
4808  ReadDarwinCpu(cpu_ticks2);
4809 
4810  Long_t userticks = (cpu_ticks2[0] + cpu_ticks2[3]) -
4811  (cpu_ticks1[0] + cpu_ticks1[3]);
4812  Long_t systicks = cpu_ticks2[1] - cpu_ticks1[1];
4813  Long_t idleticks = cpu_ticks2[2] - cpu_ticks1[2];
4814  if (userticks < 0) userticks = 0;
4815  if (systicks < 0) systicks = 0;
4816  if (idleticks < 0) idleticks = 0;
4817  Long_t totalticks = userticks + systicks + idleticks;
4818  if (totalticks) {
4819  cpuinfo->fUser = ((Float_t)(100 * userticks)) / ((Float_t)totalticks);
4820  cpuinfo->fSys = ((Float_t)(100 * systicks)) / ((Float_t)totalticks);
4821  cpuinfo->fTotal = cpuinfo->fUser + cpuinfo->fSys;
4822  cpuinfo->fIdle = ((Float_t)(100 * idleticks)) / ((Float_t)totalticks);
4823  }
4824 }
4825 
4826 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4827 /// Get VM stat for Mac OS X.
4828 
4829 static void GetDarwinMemInfo(MemInfo_t *meminfo)
4830 {
4831  static Int_t pshift = 0;
4832  static DIR *dirp;
4833  vm_statistics_data_t vm_info;
4834  mach_msg_type_number_t count;
4835  kern_return_t kr;
4836  struct dirent *dp;
4837  Long64_t total, used, free, swap_total, swap_used;
4838 
4839  count = HOST_VM_INFO_COUNT;
4840  kr = host_statistics(mach_host_self(), HOST_VM_INFO, (host_info_t)&vm_info, &count);
4841  if (kr != KERN_SUCCESS) {
4842  ::Error("TUnixSystem::GetDarwinMemInfo", "host_statistics: %s", mach_error_string(kr));
4843  return;
4844  }
4845  if (pshift == 0) {
4846  for (int psize = getpagesize(); psize > 1; psize >>= 1)
4847  pshift++;
4848  }
4849 
4850  used = (Long64_t)(vm_info.active_count + vm_info.inactive_count + vm_info.wire_count) << pshift;
4851  free = (Long64_t)(vm_info.free_count) << pshift;
4852  total = (Long64_t)(vm_info.active_count + vm_info.inactive_count + vm_info.free_count + vm_info.wire_count) << pshift;
4853 
4854  // Swap is available at same time as mem, so grab values here.
4855  swap_used = vm_info.pageouts << pshift;
4856 
4857  // Figure out total swap. This adds up the size of the swapfiles */
4858  dirp = opendir("/private/var/vm");
4859  if (!dirp)
4860  return;
4861 
4862  swap_total = 0;
4863  while ((dp = readdir(dirp)) != 0) {
4864  struct stat sb;
4865  char fname [MAXNAMLEN];
4866  if (strncmp(dp->d_name, "swapfile", 8))
4867  continue;
4868  strlcpy(fname, "/private/var/vm/",MAXNAMLEN);
4869  strlcat (fname, dp->d_name,MAXNAMLEN);
4870  if (stat(fname, &sb) < 0)
4871  continue;
4872  swap_total += sb.st_size;
4873  }
4874  closedir(dirp);
4875 
4876  meminfo->fMemTotal = (Int_t) (total >> 20); // divide by 1024 * 1024
4877  meminfo->fMemUsed = (Int_t) (used >> 20);
4878  meminfo->fMemFree = (Int_t) (free >> 20);
4879  meminfo->fSwapTotal = (Int_t) (swap_total >> 20);
4880  meminfo->fSwapUsed = (Int_t) (swap_used >> 20);
4881  meminfo->fSwapFree = meminfo->fSwapTotal - meminfo->fSwapUsed;
4882 }
4883 
4884 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4885 /// Get process info for this process on Mac OS X.
4886 /// Code largely taken from:
4887 /// http://www.opensource.apple.com/source/top/top-15/libtop.c
4888 /// The virtual memory usage is slightly over estimated as we don't
4889 /// subtract shared regions, but the value makes more sense
4890 /// then pure vsize, which is useless on 64-bit machines.
4891 
4892 static void GetDarwinProcInfo(ProcInfo_t *procinfo)
4893 {
4894 #ifdef _LP64
4895 #define vm_region vm_region_64
4896 #endif
4897 
4898 // taken from <mach/shared_memory_server.h> which is obsoleted in 10.5
4899 #define GLOBAL_SHARED_TEXT_SEGMENT 0x90000000U
4900 #define GLOBAL_SHARED_DATA_SEGMENT 0xA0000000U
4901 #define SHARED_TEXT_REGION_SIZE 0x10000000
4902 #define SHARED_DATA_REGION_SIZE 0x10000000
4903 
4904  struct rusage ru;
4905  if (getrusage(RUSAGE_SELF, &ru) < 0) {
4906  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::GetDarwinProcInfo", "getrusage failed");
4907  } else {
4908  procinfo->fCpuUser = (Float_t)(ru.ru_utime.tv_sec) +
4909  ((Float_t)(ru.ru_utime.tv_usec) / 1000000.);
4910  procinfo->fCpuSys = (Float_t)(ru.ru_stime.tv_sec) +
4911  ((Float_t)(ru.ru_stime.tv_usec) / 1000000.);
4912  }
4913 
4914  task_basic_info_data_t ti;
4915  mach_msg_type_number_t count;
4916  kern_return_t kr;
4917 
4918  task_t a_task = mach_task_self();
4919 
4920  count = TASK_BASIC_INFO_COUNT;
4921  kr = task_info(a_task, TASK_BASIC_INFO, (task_info_t)&ti, &count);
4922  if (kr != KERN_SUCCESS) {
4923  ::Error("TUnixSystem::GetDarwinProcInfo", "task_info: %s", mach_error_string(kr));
4924  } else {
4925  // resident size does not require any calculation. Virtual size
4926  // needs to be adjusted if traversing memory objects do not include the
4927  // globally shared text and data regions
4928  mach_port_t object_name;
4929  vm_address_t address;
4930  vm_region_top_info_data_t info;
4931  vm_size_t vsize, vprvt, rsize, size;
4932  rsize = ti.resident_size;
4933  vsize = ti.virtual_size;
4934  vprvt = 0;
4935  for (address = 0; ; address += size) {
4936  // get memory region
4937  count = VM_REGION_TOP_INFO_COUNT;
4938  if (vm_region(a_task, &address, &size,
4939  VM_REGION_TOP_INFO, (vm_region_info_t)&info, &count,
4940  &object_name) != KERN_SUCCESS) {
4941  // no more memory regions.
4942  break;
4943  }
4944 
4945  if (address >= GLOBAL_SHARED_TEXT_SEGMENT &&
4946  address < (GLOBAL_SHARED_DATA_SEGMENT + SHARED_DATA_REGION_SIZE)) {
4947  // This region is private shared.
4948  // Check if this process has the globally shared
4949  // text and data regions mapped in. If so, adjust
4950  // virtual memory size and exit loop.
4951  if (info.share_mode == SM_EMPTY) {
4952  vm_region_basic_info_data_64_t b_info;
4953  count = VM_REGION_BASIC_INFO_COUNT_64;
4954  if (vm_region_64(a_task, &address,
4955  &size, VM_REGION_BASIC_INFO,
4956  (vm_region_info_t)&b_info, &count,
4957  &object_name) != KERN_SUCCESS) {
4958  break;
4959  }
4960 
4961  if (b_info.reserved) {
4962  vsize -= (SHARED_TEXT_REGION_SIZE + SHARED_DATA_REGION_SIZE);
4963  //break; // only for vsize
4964  }
4965  }
4966  // Short circuit the loop if this isn't a shared
4967  // private region, since that's the only region
4968  // type we care about within the current address range.
4969  if (info.share_mode != SM_PRIVATE) {
4970  continue;
4971  }
4972  }
4973  switch (info.share_mode) {
4974  case SM_COW: {
4975  if (info.ref_count == 1) {
4976  vprvt += size;
4977  } else {
4978  vprvt += info.private_pages_resident * getpagesize();
4979  }
4980  break;
4981  }
4982  case SM_PRIVATE: {
4983  vprvt += size;
4984  break;
4985  }
4986  default:
4987  break;
4988  }
4989  }
4990 
4991  procinfo->fMemResident = (Long_t)(rsize / 1024);
4992  //procinfo->fMemVirtual = (Long_t)(vsize / 1024);
4993  procinfo->fMemVirtual = (Long_t)(vprvt / 1024);
4994  }
4995 }
4996 #endif
4997 
4998 #if defined(R__LINUX)
4999 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5000 /// Get system info for Linux. Only fBusSpeed is not set.
5001 
5002 static void GetLinuxSysInfo(SysInfo_t *sysinfo)
5003 {
5004  TString s;
5005  FILE *f = fopen("/proc/cpuinfo", "r");
5006  if (f) {
5007  while (s.Gets(f)) {
5008  if (s.BeginsWith("model name")) {
5009  TPRegexp("^.+: *(.*$)").Substitute(s, "$1");
5010  sysinfo->fModel = s;
5011  }
5012  if (s.BeginsWith("cpu MHz")) {
5013  TPRegexp("^.+: *([^ ]+).*").Substitute(s, "$1");
5014  sysinfo->fCpuSpeed = s.Atoi();
5015  }
5016  if (s.BeginsWith("cache size")) {
5017  TPRegexp("^.+: *([^ ]+).*").Substitute(s, "$1");
5018  sysinfo->fL2Cache = s.Atoi();
5019  }
5020  if (s.BeginsWith("processor")) {
5021  TPRegexp("^.+: *([^ ]+).*").Substitute(s, "$1");
5022  sysinfo->fCpus = s.Atoi();
5023  sysinfo->fCpus++;
5024  }
5025  }
5026  fclose(f);
5027  }
5028 
5029  f = fopen("/proc/meminfo", "r");
5030  if (f) {
5031  while (s.Gets(f)) {
5032  if (s.BeginsWith("MemTotal")) {
5033  TPRegexp("^.+: *([^ ]+).*").Substitute(s, "$1");
5034  sysinfo->fPhysRam = (s.Atoi() / 1024);
5035  break;
5036  }
5037  }
5038  fclose(f);
5039  }
5040 
5041  f = gSystem->OpenPipe("uname -s -p", "r");
5042  if (f) {
5043  s.Gets(f);
5044  Ssiz_t from = 0;
5045  s.Tokenize(sysinfo->fOS, from);
5046  s.Tokenize(sysinfo->fCpuType, from);
5047  gSystem->ClosePipe(f);
5048  }
5049 }
5050 
5051 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5052 /// Get CPU load on Linux.
5053 
5054 static void ReadLinuxCpu(long *ticks)
5055 {
5056  ticks[0] = ticks[1] = ticks[2] = ticks[3] = 0;
5057 
5058  TString s;
5059  FILE *f = fopen("/proc/stat", "r");
5060  if (!f) return;
5061  s.Gets(f);
5062  // user, user nice, sys, idle
5063  sscanf(s.Data(), "%*s %ld %ld %ld %ld", &ticks[0], &ticks[3], &ticks[1], &ticks[2]);
5064  fclose(f);
5065 }
5066 
5067 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5068 /// Get CPU stat for Linux. Use sampleTime to set the interval over which
5069 /// the CPU load will be measured, in ms (default 1000).
5070 
5071 static void GetLinuxCpuInfo(CpuInfo_t *cpuinfo, Int_t sampleTime)
5072 {
5073  Double_t avg[3] = { -1., -1., -1. };
5074 #ifndef R__WINGCC
5075  if (getloadavg(avg, sizeof(avg)) < 0) {
5076  ::Error("TUnixSystem::GetLinuxCpuInfo", "getloadavg failed");
5077  } else
5078 #endif
5079  {
5080  cpuinfo->fLoad1m = (Float_t)avg[0];
5081  cpuinfo->fLoad5m = (Float_t)avg[1];
5082  cpuinfo->fLoad15m = (Float_t)avg[2];
5083  }
5084 
5085  Long_t cpu_ticks1[4], cpu_ticks2[4];
5086  ReadLinuxCpu(cpu_ticks1);
5087  gSystem->Sleep(sampleTime);
5088  ReadLinuxCpu(cpu_ticks2);
5089 
5090  Long_t userticks = (cpu_ticks2[0] + cpu_ticks2[3]) -
5091  (cpu_ticks1[0] + cpu_ticks1[3]);
5092  Long_t systicks = cpu_ticks2[1] - cpu_ticks1[1];
5093  Long_t idleticks = cpu_ticks2[2] - cpu_ticks1[2];
5094  if (userticks < 0) userticks = 0;
5095  if (systicks < 0) systicks = 0;
5096  if (idleticks < 0) idleticks = 0;
5097  Long_t totalticks = userticks + systicks + idleticks;
5098  if (totalticks) {
5099  cpuinfo->fUser = ((Float_t)(100 * userticks)) / ((Float_t)totalticks);
5100  cpuinfo->fSys = ((Float_t)(100 * systicks)) / ((Float_t)totalticks);
5101  cpuinfo->fTotal = cpuinfo->fUser + cpuinfo->fSys;
5102  cpuinfo->fIdle = ((Float_t)(100 * idleticks)) / ((Float_t)totalticks);
5103  }
5104 }
5105 
5106 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5107 /// Get VM stat for Linux.
5108 
5109 static void GetLinuxMemInfo(MemInfo_t *meminfo)
5110 {
5111  TString s;
5112  FILE *f = fopen("/proc/meminfo", "r");
5113  if (!f) return;
5114  while (s.Gets(f)) {
5115  if (s.BeginsWith("MemTotal")) {
5116  TPRegexp("^.+: *([^ ]+).*").Substitute(s, "$1");
5117  meminfo->fMemTotal = (s.Atoi() / 1024);
5118  }
5119  if (s.BeginsWith("MemFree")) {
5120  TPRegexp("^.+: *([^ ]+).*").Substitute(s, "$1");
5121  meminfo->fMemFree = (s.Atoi() / 1024);
5122  }
5123  if (s.BeginsWith("SwapTotal")) {
5124  TPRegexp("^.+: *([^ ]+).*").Substitute(s, "$1");
5125  meminfo->fSwapTotal = (s.Atoi() / 1024);
5126  }
5127  if (s.BeginsWith("SwapFree")) {
5128  TPRegexp("^.+: *([^ ]+).*").Substitute(s, "$1");
5129  meminfo->fSwapFree = (s.Atoi() / 1024);
5130  }
5131  }
5132  fclose(f);
5133 
5134  meminfo->fMemUsed = meminfo->fMemTotal - meminfo->fMemFree;
5135  meminfo->fSwapUsed = meminfo->fSwapTotal - meminfo->fSwapFree;
5136 }
5137 
5138 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5139 /// Get process info for this process on Linux.
5140 
5141 static void GetLinuxProcInfo(ProcInfo_t *procinfo)
5142 {
5143  struct rusage ru;
5144  if (getrusage(RUSAGE_SELF, &ru) < 0) {
5145  ::SysError("TUnixSystem::GetLinuxProcInfo", "getrusage failed");
5146  } else {
5147  procinfo->fCpuUser = (Float_t)(ru.ru_utime.tv_sec) +
5148  ((Float_t)(ru.ru_utime.tv_usec) / 1000000.);
5149  procinfo->fCpuSys = (Float_t)(ru.ru_stime.tv_sec) +
5150  ((Float_t)(ru.ru_stime.tv_usec) / 1000000.);
5151  }
5152 
5153  procinfo->fMemVirtual = -1;
5154  procinfo->fMemResident = -1;
5155  TString s;
5156  FILE *f = fopen(TString::Format("/proc/%d/statm", gSystem->GetPid()), "r");
5157  if (f) {
5158  s.Gets(f);
5159  fclose(f);
5160  Long_t total, rss;
5161  sscanf(s.Data(), "%ld %ld", &total, &rss);
5162  procinfo->fMemVirtual = total * (getpagesize() / 1024);
5163  procinfo->fMemResident = rss * (getpagesize() / 1024);
5164  }
5165 }
5166 #endif
5167 
5168 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5169 /// Returns static system info, like OS type, CPU type, number of CPUs
5170 /// RAM size, etc into the SysInfo_t structure. Returns -1 in case of error,
5171 /// 0 otherwise.
5172 
5173 int TUnixSystem::GetSysInfo(SysInfo_t *info) const
5174 {
5175  if (!info) return -1;
5176 
5177  static SysInfo_t sysinfo;
5178 
5179  if (!sysinfo.fCpus) {
5180 #if defined(R__MACOSX)
5181  GetDarwinSysInfo(&sysinfo);
5182 #elif defined(R__LINUX)
5183  GetLinuxSysInfo(&sysinfo);
5184 #endif
5185  }
5186 
5187  *info = sysinfo;
5188 
5189  return 0;
5190 }
5191 
5192 ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5193 /// Returns cpu load average and load info into the CpuInfo_t structure.
5194 /// Returns -1 in case of error, 0 otherwise. Use sampleTime to set the
5195 /// interval over which the CPU load will be measured, in ms (default 1000).
5196 
5197 int TUnixSystem::GetCpuInfo(CpuInfo_t *info, Int_t sampleTime) const
5198 {
5199  if (!info) return -1;
5200 
5201 #if defined(R__MACOSX)
5202  GetDarwinCpuInfo(info, sampleTime);
5203 #elif defined(R__LINUX)
5204  GetLinuxCpuInfo(info, sampleTime);
5205 #endif
5206 
5207  return 0;
5208 }
5209

5223 
5224  return 0;
5225 }
